column37: Nine students graduated from different programmes of Hong Kong Art School, pay their tribute to toys through their artworks. It has been told that “riding a hobby saps one's will to make progress”, however, nowadays, a group of “Kidult”, which refers to adults having their curiosity and playfulness remained intact, has become the pioneers in filling the generation gap between pragmatic adults and innocent kids.
column38: 由九個香港藝術學院不同課程畢業的學生，展出以「玩具與人的微妙關係」為主題的藝術作品。在現今世代，玩具不一定是喪志的，一班童心未泯的成年人，亦即「KIDULT」，持守玩賞者的執著，成為了成年人的務實與小孩子天真爛漫間的鴻溝。

column9: Umbrella Plaza, Admiralty
column10: 金鐘雨傘廣場
column37: Birthday song comes with birthday cake. When the protesters of Umbrella movement faced some unreasonable complaints and insults by some people, they would sing birthday song in return, resolving the grievances to blessing. Instead of celebratory phrases, on the work "Birthday Cakes" are the statements that caused controversy, for examples, "The Sino-British Joint Declaration is void." "Hong Kong is China's direct -controlled municipality." Is this a blessing or a curse? Delicious or hard to eat? Real cakes were served as a form of performance in the exhibition. To eat can mean digest and agree with something or disagree with something and eat it with anger. It is up to the audience on how to eat the cakes.
column38: 有生日歌，自然有生日蛋糕。雨傘運動的示威者面對反佔中的投訴及辱罵，有時會以祝福的形式唱生日歌回應，化解怨氣。生日蛋糕上通常是祝福的語句，作品《生日蛋糕》把引起港人激烈反應的語句放上生日蛋糕，例如：「中英聯合聲明失效」；「香港是中國的直轄市」；這是祝福還是詛咒？吃得津津有味還是吃不下？硬食還是廢食？作品製成實體蛋糕，由觀眾決定怎樣吃與不吃。

column9: agnès b.’s LIBRAIRIE GALERIE, G/F, 118 Hollywood Road, Central, HK
column19: "DANCE" PHOTOGRAPHY EXHIBITION CURATED BY EUGENIA GRANDCHAMP DES RAUX
column37: agnès b.s’ LIBRAIRIE GALERIE is delighted to present DANCE, a solo photography exhibition by the French artist, Eugenia Grandchamp des Raux. A series of photographs that captures the ballet dancers of the Opéra de Paris in the Monde-Flou (World of blur) is being shown in the exhibition to express the artist’s great passion for dance. “World of blur” is the continuation of movement, the representation of vibration and even a part of life. The photographs reflect her deep desire to restore the snapshots of still images to movement and share the dreams behind.

column19: "If I can see" Student Charity Drawing Exhibition
column20: 「若能看見」學生作品慈善畫展
column38:
畫展理念
========
詩歌：若你能看見
  如若你能看見藍天，能望到千朵白雲隨風轉，
　願你不忘記感謝神，能看見絕未必然！
　如若你能聽見潮聲，能聽見千萬狂濤飛濺，
　願你不忘記感謝神，能聽見乃主恩典！
　環顧世上不知幾多眼睛，連自己雙手亦無從一見！
　若你抬頭仍舊見藍天，請緊記凝望多遍！
　環顧世上數不清的耳朵，連父親聲音亦從未聽見！
　若你偶然緩步至岸邊，請多聽潮浪一遍！

若能看見是必然的事嗎？我有深近視，放下了眼鏡真的好像盲了一樣。今天我可以看見花草樹木，孩子可愛的臉龐，爸爸媽媽親切溫馨的笑臉，是上帝的恩典。有時我們真的以為一切理所當然，沒有什麼可珍惜的。但…….當知道一切可以不是必然。我們希望孩子學習珍惜及感恩，也學習施予。

「奧比斯」是一個國際性的非營利醫療教育組織，肩負全球救盲使命。透過提供醫療設備和技術，以及培訓眼科醫護人員，協助發展中國家制訂長遠的救盲計劃，解決可避免的失明問題。

今次我們的畫展希望透過繪畫來籌款，把善款全數撥捐「奧比斯」，盼望它們把各位的愛心，分享到每一個需要光明的人、光明的世界、光明的角落。

畫展共展出284位學生合共320份繪畫作品，讓我們一同見証學生的成長。

column19: “Box it up” -Solo Exhibition of Nguyen Dinh Vu
column37: Humans are hard to read. Dinh Vu tried to capture the multiple facial expressions that a person has, there are just too many. Instead, he cased them in a carton box, leaving it for the beholders to imagine and guess what it is like. Without sentiment, Dinh Vu drew boxed-up people in different scenarios that can be in millions of situations. These people can be anyone, anywhere, with all kinds of thinking. The artist offers his audiences the freedom by putting them in confinement.

column9: Room 701, Blissful building, 247 Des Voeux Road Central, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37:
We are pleased to showcase the latest art works from the Netherlands artist Tobias Spierenburg
Dutch artist Tobias Spierenburg shows a variation of ambiances of his favorite subject. In most of the paintings the landscape has almost disappeared, fog and various effects of light leave only a subtle impression of the spots he has visited. With minimal means an image is being created. Often only small differences in tone and colour are being used, and all that is considered distractive is left out. By working in this manner, with personally developed techniques, the painter achieves a striking calmness in his work. The viewer is invited to look, and to look again at the painting as the painter has done at his subject.
Painting in this manner becomes a kind of meditation, although the eye sees the same thing over and over again, the way of perceiving remains intense. All the more appropriate is the choice for specific techniques with different layers of oil paint which require much time to dry. Tobias Spierenburg uses a great number of these thin layers, allowing him to obtain specific colours that are often difficult to define.
The role of the light is very important to his work.  The light that shines through the leaves and casts shadows on the ground changes continually  through the day, affected by seasons and weather; it becomes an endless source of inspiration.

column36:
《旮旯》聯展是文藝復興基金會跟本地插畫師Leumas To 首度的展覽合作計劃，展覽的動機及內容跟文藝復興基金會強調的獨立精神、自由思想的文藝創作互相呼應。
 
四位參展人均是策展人一直很欣賞的獨立創作人，他們各自在個別創作範疇都有着重要的影響力。在今次的聯展，他們會透過攝影、繪畫、詩歌和錄像等跨界媒體呈現不同的旮旯風景。
 
另外，為了配合對「獨立精神」的探索及思考，Leumas To邀請了四位參展人，以及八位舉足輕重的獨立創作人 / 文化人，包括作家鄧小樺、設計師毛灼然、漫畫家黎達達榮、獨立文化人馮美華等進行創作訪談，並輯錄成《旮旯訪談》書冊，於展覽現場限量發售。

column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column19: 2014 Alumni Exhibition of Hong Kong Art School--Conception and Perception
column20: 2014香港藝術學院校友作品展-Conception and Perception
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37:
In the contemporary world of art and art making as well as art appreciation, no matter you are the art maker or the viewer, there may not always be a definite answer to the question you have in mind towards a work of art. The subtle connection between the maker's concept and the viewer's perception is always intriguing, even though it may sometimes come with a contradictory sense. As an art maker, do you always anticipate and enjoy the communication with the viewer through your work? What does the issue of “Conception and Perception” mean to you?

Through the exhibition “Conception and Perception”, the alumni of the Hong Kong Art School would like to explore the essence and the value of art practice, discovering different possibilities of art making with the public.
column38:
於當代藝術世界，無論你是創作者或是觀看者，在藝術創作與欣賞兩方面，對於一件作品的領悟與理解未必能有一致的看法與觀點。然而在創作者的意念與觀看者對作品的知覺之間卻有著微妙而不著跡的連繫，那管兩者對該作品的感覺是一致抑或南轅北轍。香港藝術學院藝廊藉著今年校友展覽擲出這「問題」給學院校友 --- 作為創作者，你會有多麽期盼或享受以作品跟觀者交流溝通呢？ Conception & Perception (意念與知覺) 的議題對於你有何意義？
香港藝術學院藝廊將與校友再次攜手探索藝術實踐的精髓及其真正價值，與公眾進一步發掘藝術各種不同的可能性。

column19: 30 Years of Sound Art in Hong Kong, Mainland China and the World presents: Ellen Fullman and Theresa Wong
column37:
For our third event of 30 years of Sound Art in Hong Kong, China, and the World, we feature Ellen Fullman playing her 15 meter-long string instrument for the first time in Hong Kong.
Since 1981, Fullman has been developing the “Long String Instrument,” an installation of dozens of wires 15 meters or more in length, tuned in Just Intonation and ‘bowed’ with rosin coated fingers. Over the years she has devised a unique notation system to choreograph the performer’s movements, exploring sonic events that occur at specific nodal point locations along the string-length of the instrument. These extended wires produce a chorus of minimal, organ-like overtones, which some has compared to the experience of standing inside an enormous grand piano.
Fullman has recorded extensively with this unusual instrument and has collaborated with such luminary figures as composer Pauline Oliveros, choreographer Deborah Hay, the Kronos Quartet, and Keiji Haino. She has been the recipient of numerous awards, commissions and residencies including: DAAD Artists-in-Berlin Program residency, Japan/U.S. Friendship Commission/NEA Fellowship for Japan, Meet the Composer, Reader’s Digest Consortium Commission, Artist Trust/Washington State Arts Commission Fellowship, and artist-in-residence at Headlands Center for the Arts. Her music was represented in The American Century; Art and Culture, 1950-2000 at The Whitney Museum, and she has performed in venues and festivals in Europe, Japan, and the Americas including: Instal, Lincoln Center Out-of-Doors, Other Minds, the Walker Art Center and Donaueschinger Musiktage.
For this occasion Fullman will be collaborating with cellist and vocalist Theresa Wong. Wong has worked extensively in the field of Contemporary Music and Improvised Music. Her solo project for voice and cello was released from Tzadik, and she has performed internationally including Fondation Cartier in Paris, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco, Fabbrica Europa in Florence, and Unlimited 21 Festival in Wels.

column19: a bit more than Arts Festival
column29: Arts with the Disabled Association Hong Kong
column36: 賽馬會共融藝術工房各類表演藝術工作坊的學員
column38:
《多一點藝術節》自2011年舉辦至今，展示了不同能力人士的藝術創作成果，公眾對共融藝術已有一定認識。
 
過去一年，賽馬會共融藝術工房透過《香港賽馬會社區資助計劃——共融藝術計劃》內的各個項目，引領公眾及社區在共融路上走得更廣更遠。本年度的《多一點藝術節》以「共融藝術新路向」為主題，展示及分享工房所接觸和學習到的不同藝術形式，以及與不同伙伴的合作成果。
 
工房為「共融藝術」的發展注入了不少嶄新元素。「藝術筆友」繼續與德國及台灣以藝匯友，以本地故事和作品進行交流。最近一期之「藝術筆友」惠及更多本地團體，亦邀得美國德州加入，活動更豐富。「開放工作室」為公眾人士帶來新的藝術體驗，吸引更多新朋友參與，認識藝術的不同面向。「展能藝術培訓」透過主題導向的課程，除了著重訓練學員不同的創作技巧，擴闊視野；亦鼓勵學員表達個人想法，從不同角度了解自己及社區，令作品面貌更豐富。
 
「導師培訓」教授與不同能力人士分享藝術的技巧，同時探討「共融」如何在活動籌劃上實踐。學員汲取海外的經驗及方法，將所學回饋社會。「社區藝術活動」透過藝術與社區緊密聯繫，將共融訊息廣傳。工房積極走出社區，以演出、活動帶領及分享、展覽等形式與不同藝術家及團體合作，與公眾交流。本年度「周年展覽及演出」展示了具技巧富創意的學習成果，亦強調分享創作過程的感悟和探索，務求讓公眾從不同層面感受、認識和瞭解工房的發展。
 
本屆《多一點藝術節》將於2015年1月2日至2月15日期間舉行，當中包括展覽、前行禮暨演出、導賞團暨工作坊、藝術分享及體驗工作坊等活動。歡迎各界人士親身體驗藝術的多元及互動，與工房一起於共融藝術的路上創造無限可能。《多一點藝術節》自2011年舉辦至今，展示了不同能力人士的藝術創作成果，公眾對共融藝術已有一定認識。
 
過去一年，賽馬會共融藝術工房透過《香港賽馬會社區資助計劃——共融藝術計劃》內的各個項目，引領公眾及社區在共融路上走得更廣更遠。本年度的《多一點藝術節》以「共融藝術新路向」為主題，展示及分享工房所接觸和學習到的不同藝術形式，以及與不同伙伴的合作成果。

「導師培訓」教授與不同能力人士分享藝術的技巧，同時探討「共融」如何在活動籌劃上實踐。學員汲取海外的經驗及方法，將所學回饋社會。「社區藝術活動」透過藝術與社區緊密聯繫，將共融訊息廣傳。工房積極走出社區，以演出、活動帶領及分享、展覽等形式與不同藝術家及團體合作，與公眾交流。本年度「周年展覽及演出」展示了具技巧富創意的學習成果，亦強調分享創作過程的感悟和探索，務求讓公眾從不同層面感受、認識和瞭解工房的發展。
 
本屆《多一點藝術節》將於2015年1月2日至2月15日期間舉行，當中包括展覽、前行禮暨演出、導賞團暨工作坊、藝術分享及體驗工作坊等活動。歡迎各界人士親身體驗藝術的多元及互動，與工房一起於共融藝術的路上創造無限可能。

column19: Aleksejs Naumovs and Kristaps Zarins exhibition "Riga and World Cities: Live Paintings"
column37:
This exhibit is part of their ongoing project "Riga and World Cities. Live Paintings Naumovs. Zarins" which focuses on urban landscapes and the unique atmosphere of global metropolises and historic cities. It is a colorful journey from Riga to Hong Kong, Miami, New York, Washington, Venice, Paris and countless other destinations, all of which the artists have visited during the last 5 years.

For artists plein air painting is about taking home memories contemplating the subject with all senses. This time with smell, touch, temperature, weather, sound and the feeling of Hong Kong.

column35: anothermountainman, Chow Chun-fai, John Choy, Henry Chu, Scott Hessels, Ho Sin-tung,
column36:
又一山人、周俊輝、
蔡旭威、朱力行、史考特•赫塞爾斯、何倩彤、關子維、李啟華、邵志飛、古希婻、蘇慧怡、湯馬仕•瓦立祁、尹子聰、余家豪
column37:
The Animamix Biennale has been held in Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou and Taipei since 2007,
showcasing contemporary art under the influence of the unique aesthetic and culture of animation and
comics. In 2013-14, apart from Shanghai and Beijing, Daegu in Korea, Kaohsiung in Taiwan, Macau and
Hong Kong also participate in the festival. vA! and Oi! will collaborate with the City University of Hong
Kong in organising the exhibition to examine ‘time’ and ‘speed’— the intrinsic nature of animation and
comics. The speediness and slowness in animation affects our mental and cognitive perception towards
visual images; while contemporary art often shapes time into grotesques through various media
and technologies. They challenge the established conception of the viewers and open up a broader
aesthetical experience for our sensual world.
column38:
動漫美學雙年展自2007年分別於上海、北京、廣州、台北等地舉行，展示當代藝術在動畫及漫畫影
響下所產生的獨特美學和文化特質。於2013-14年，除了上海、北京外，南韓大邱、高雄、澳門及
香港亦參與其中。香港視覺藝術中心、油街實現聯同香港城市大學，以「時間」及「速度」為探討
的對象，審視動漫藝術本質上的概念。動漫的快與慢影響著我們的心理及對視覺圖像的認知；當代
藝術透過不同媒體塑造時間的奇形怪狀，挑戰觀者既有的觀念，為我們的感官世界開拓更廣闊的視
覺美學體驗。

column10: L0 藝廊
column20: 高志強攝影作品選 不／離
column37: 從七十年代初踏足中國內地的好奇探索,到晚近看透繁華假象的省思洞察,期間隨時代推移而變遷的人事世態,這裡結集的影像最多或只能作為極概略而散碎的提示。然而它們卻足以帶來深刻的印象和有力的感染 。歷年持續創作的軌跡在周折波動間,除顯露了創作者關懷社會議題的苦心和熱忱,亦同時落實了清晰可辨的個人風格, 而此中在眾多題材迥異的作品中始終未嘗散失的,是那彷佛能長時維持活躍、永無倦意的敏銳觸覺。

column14: Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre
column19: ART | BASEL Hong Kong 2015: "Garden Cruising: It's not that easy being green"
column20: 香港巴塞爾藝術展2015: “遊園：不太容易做綠色。”
column37:
Blindspot Gallery is delighted to announce our participation in the DISCOVERIES section at Art|Basel Hong Kong this year at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre on 15-17 March 2015 with the exhibition “Garden Cruising: It's not that easy being green”, featuring the photography-based work of Hong Kong artist Trevor Yeung. The showcase spotlights selections from an on-going series Sleepy Bed (2011-present) and new series Enigma (2015) and more, which encapsulate the artist’s drawing his creative impetus from everyday life. The exhibition invites thinking about the relationship between the viewer and an image, about the act of viewing, as well as transforming a one-way viewing experience of art into a participatory one.

Yeung is also shortlisted in BMW Art Journey with the exhibition from DISCOVERIES section at Art | Basel Hong Kong 2015. Launched by Art Basel and BMW, this special award enables selected artists to design a journey of creative discovery to a destination of their choice.
column38:
刺點畫廊將於三月十五至十七日於香港巴塞爾藝術展的「藝術探新」展出楊沛鏗個展“遊園：不太容易做綠色。”。楊氏以攝影作為主要的創作媒介，展出作品包括持續發展系列《酣 睡床》（2011至今）、全新系列《扭擰》（2015）及其它，作品展現了藝術家從日常生活帶出的無窮創作力。展覽讓觀者思考自身與圖像的關係及其觀看的行為，以及把單向的觀看經驗轉化為可參與的體驗。

楊氏以此個展入選由巴塞爾藝術展與寶馬集團合辦的全新獎項「寶馬藝術之旅」，讓獲選藝術家展開創意探索之旅，自行設計行程到自選目的地。

column38: 近年台灣與香港的藝術家與非營利組織體認到藝術具教育、讓人重新思考生活態度的功能，積極投入對公民意識、社群生活、文化資產等議題的關注，發起多項具創意的倡議和行動聯結。媒合兩地的「與社會交往的藝術」，期望透過展覽、工作坊、論壇的對話，深入認識此藝術表現在各自社會所代表的意涵與影響。

column37: Visit 10 Chancery Lane Gallery at Booth 1D38 and Encounters E3 at Art Basel Hong Kong 2015! The gallery will exhibit work from the 1970s by Hong Kong artist Frog King (Kwok Mang Ho), and the 1980s by Chinese artists Huang Rui and Wang Keping. Three defining artists from Hong Kong and China! They are joined by important Vietnamese artist, Dinh Q. Le whose work will be featured in a major retrospective at the Mori Museum in the Summer of 2015.

column37:
Artscape Journey _ children and teenager art exhibition
Have you even been on a journey? You take little journeys all the time: you go to school or work, walk down the street, ride in a car or a bus. On any of these journeys you might see something new, something that changes your point of view. 

In this exhibition, you’ll see about the children and their “Artscape Journeys”. You’ll find out how they think, what they like, and where their journeys have taken them. They have found different materials to work with and explored new ideas. As you travel through their art works, our little artists’ journeys might lead anywhere.
column38:
藝遊風景_兒童及青少年藝術作品展
在生活的路途上，你可曾在老事物中發現新觀點？
平凡的早餐感受親情；
梳妝臺前的鏡子發現世界；
辟辟啪啪裡聯繫上故事；
樹上飄來一個又一個的夢……
在平凡的生活裡，在每天營營役役的旅途中，我們不能把時間、空間、風景停住，我們卻能帶着探索精神，隨時睜亮眼睛，記錄途中的人、事、物，賦予情感與奇想，以藝術創作把生活點滴留住保存。
藝遊風景展覽就是把學童日常的平凡生活，以藝術的角度展現他們心中所感所想。

column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37:
"Everything we see hides another thing, we always want to see what is hidden by what we see. … Mystery is nothing. It's unknowable…" -René Magritte. 
Once mystery induces curiosity, curiosity pushes us to discover more about the hidden story. Therefore what lies behind the curtain is all about human curiosity, which is always attributed to one's psychological condition. Yu Pui Shan, a graduate of the Hong Kong Art School's Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme (majoring in Painting) would like to respond to the audience's curiosity through the curtain— the motif of her paintings in her solo exhibition. Will this new motif, would it give more imagery space to the viewers? Or will it limit the hints to solving the mystery? Probably it is the core of the exhibition.
column38:
「我們看見的所有事物都另藏別的東西…我們常想看到背後隱藏著的…神秘是虛無， 是不明的…」－雷內•馬格利特 
當神祕引發起好奇時，好奇就驅使我們去發掘更多背後的故事，於是布簾背後隱藏著的全是關係於人類的好奇，這常歸因於個人的心理狀態。余佩珊，香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程畢業生(主修繪畫)，透過布簾這個圖案於是次展覽「幕後花絮」回應觀眾的好奇。在新的系列作品中她會打破舊有常規，改變以往創作的風格。在這新的創作思想中心，會給觀眾更多想像空間？抑或欠缺了提示去解開謎團？這就是是次展覽的核心所在。

toof [ contemporary ] proudly presents Vanessa Franklin’s first exhibition in Hong Kong. The exhibition encompasses a Double Exhibition featuring two series by Vanessa Franklin combined to showcase the artist’s work.

Vanessa Franklin's Portraits, elegant yet humorous, take on female identity, sexuality and her relation to the women she portrays. Vanessa Franklin was born in Paris, worked in London, Tokyo and now Hong Kong.

column37:
Catharsis has been recognized as a healing, cleansing, and transforming experience throughout history, and has been used in cultural healing practices, literature, drama, religion, medicine, and psychology. 
This exhibition is about artist’s curious to see if a sense of ‘Catharsis’ could be found or implemented through artistic approach?
column38:
“淨化”(catharsis)該字是由一個意思為“清潔”或“純化”的希臘字而來，大多數強調包含感情方面以及認知方面的兩個基本組成。
本展覽發想於藝術家的好奇心，透過數位影像，互動裝置，照片與文本等媒材，新媒體藝術家洪強想測試 “淨化” 這個抽象而廣泛的概念及感覺是否可以通過藝術的方式來實現？

column19: Comix Salon: Themed Display of Comics by Hong Kong and Taiwanese Artists
column20: 動漫沙龍——港臺漫畫專題展示
column37: A Parallel Tale – the exhibition that gathers comics artists from Hong Kong and Taiwan – will commence in Comix Home Base at the end of June! With this exciting event happening around, Comix Salon is now showcasing a selection of works by the participating artists in its little themed display area. Visitors are welcome to pay a visit to Comix Salon after looking at the drawings at the exhibition, as these comic books give a better idea about how the comics artists tackle longer sequential narrative with their own distinctive styles. Besides, there will be some comic publications donated by Dala Publishing from Taiwan in the display area, enabling visitors to get to know more comics works from the region.
column38: 集合港臺兩地漫畫家的《漫漫畫雙城——臺北80 X 香港90》漫畫展於6月下旬在動漫基地正式開幕！為配合展覽，動漫沙龍特別於小型書籍專題展示區展示各位參展漫畫家出版過的刊物，觀眾在欣賞展覽後，不妨到訪動漫沙龍，從頁頁的漫畫故事了解各創作人擅長的風格和表現手法。展示區另展示由大辣出版有限公司捐贈的臺灣漫畫書，讓公眾能接觸更多當地的優秀之作。

column19: Dear Hashtag - Letters to Design—Bachelor of Arts in Applied and Media Arts Annual Exhibition of Students’ Works 2014
column20: 「Dear Hashtag──Letter to Design」──應用及媒體藝術文學士學生作品年展二零一四
column29: Hong Kong Art School, School of Professional Education and Executive Development, Hong Kong Polytechnic University
column30: 香港藝術學院、香港理工大學專業進修學院
column37:
Titled “Dear Hashtag - Letters to Design”, the annual exhibition of the Bachelor of Arts in Applied and Media Arts programme showcases artworks of 29 graduates with diverse topics ranging from self-reflection to social issues. 

Hashtag#, a popular tag in the Internet, is widely used in different social media platforms.　Hashtag can effectively connect the contents of different topics, facilitating the search as well as forming a large and extensive network. 　In the eyes of graduates, a variety of design themes can be “hashtaged”. 　The graduates connect 29 individual designs by using the principles and patterns of the hashtag, sharing their artworks with the public. 　The artworks including the various design solutions and installations demonstrate the many-facets of multimedia arts.

There will be guided tours for secondary schools, interested parties please call 2824 5371 for reservation.
column38:
一年一度的應用及媒體藝術文學士課程年展即將舉行，是次展覽以「Dear Hashtag ── Letters to Design」為題，共展出29位畢業生的作品，題材豐富，內容涉獵甚廣，從自我反思以至社會議題等。

Hashtag # 為一種近年在互聯網上興起的標籤方式，在各大社交平台上被廣泛應用，能有效把不同話題內容相互聯繫，便於搜索，形成一個龐大又豐富的網絡。在畢業生眼中，各式各樣的設計主題都可被標籤（Hashtag），運用hashtag的原理和模式，參展畢業生把29個獨立設計理念串連在一起，與公眾分享創作成果。是次展出的作品包括不同主題的設計方案，配合多媒體裝置，呈現出應用及媒體藝術的特色。

column35: Danny Lau，Wrongwroks, Santo Bongiorno, Mini C, Foster Eastman
column37:
Where is the world’s most desolate place? 
Tibetan mountaintops? U.S. Route 50, the loneliest road in America? 
Fact is, you don't need to travel halfway across the globe to separate yourself from civilization. 
Our 24/7 connected societies are driving us farther apart. 
Is desolation caused by the emptiness of human’s heart and the lack of human touch? 
Is the state of being desolated helps creativities? 
Is desolation a deprivation of companionship and loneliness? 
Through photography, painting, and multi-media work, artists from Italy, Hong Kong, and Canada redefine desolation.

column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column35: Yau Ngai Lam, Chow Hoi Lam Jenny, Chung Yan Wing Ronnie
column37:
The relationship between connecting and disconnecting is vague. 

Living in the world, we are all linked together and repelling against each other, even if we are not intentionally connecting or disconnecting with someone, someplace or something. Chow Hoi Lam Jenny, Yau Ngai Lam, Chung Yan Wing Ronnie, graduates of the Hong Kong Art School's Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme (majoring in Painting), explore the concept of relationship through their artwork in the group exhibition.
column38:
連繫和疏離之間有着模糊的關係。

活在世上，我們都被繫在一起，與此同時，我們又互相排斥；即使我們並非有意地與某人、某地或某事物連繫或分離，亦擺脫不了這種狀態。香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程主修繪畫的畢業生─丘藝藍、周凱琳、鍾欣詠將於展覽透過作品深入地探求關係這個概念。

column37: Videotage is pleased to present the exhibition Every Every by the FUSE resident Chloe Cheuk. Every Every is a series of video and kinetic installations to extract and abstract the recurring pattern of our day-to-day existence. Cheuk sees life as a close-ended spiral, which oftentimes deceives us into the illusion of linear progress, whereas we are actually going round and round. The work particularly draws upon Cheuk’s distress about the recent occupying movement in Hong Kong where the recurring pattern is separation - union - confrontation. Cheuk is tempted to translate the pattern in visual and mechanistic language, with the seemingly innocuous objects such as the windows, kendamas and wheels that caught her attention at the site. By so doing, she slowly releases the empty and helpless feelings due to constant repression. Despite the work’s political context, what Cheuk concerns most is the fundamental meaning of an object - its mutability and its implications for individuals and society, and her tools for investigation are electronic device, video recording and editing.
column38: 錄映太奇的FUSE駐場計劃將展出香港媒體藝術家卓思穎最新的創作。《每每》包含一系列錄像與動力裝置作品，意指同樣的事情不只發生一次，我們的生活常常陷入不斷回旋，卻無甚進展的死胡同之中。利用影像及動力裝置所營造的離合與抗衡，作品呈現出藝術家面對香港佔領運動的鬱悶與不安。此次創作亦是卓氏對自身經歷的審視。她把曾在運動中與她擦身而過的物件如玻璃窗，劍球，車輪重新拼湊，釋放出持續受到壓抑的虛空和無力感。雖然作品取材自無可避免的政治問題，但卓思穎最關注的是如何捉住物件根本意義。運用電子裝置，錄像和剪接，她反覆把玩該物件的可塑性并思量其對於自身與社會的意味。

column37:
Over the years, the University Library System has acquired very finely reproduced artworks recommended by the Department of Fine Arts. The originals of these works are housed in museums such as National Palace Museum, Taipei, Shanghai Museum, and British Museum. The reproductions are made by specialists such as the Nigensha Publishing Co. Ltd. in Japan. Because a high standard of professional and specialized reproduction skill is required, only experts can distinguish the reproduced item from the original.

The Collection consists of calligraphy and painting produced from the Tang to the Qing Dynasty. Notes and interpretations are available for most items. This valuable collection is not for circulation but research only. To let more users know about the collection, selective items are being displayed at the Ch’ien Mu Library. All are welcome to visit the exhibition during the Library’s opening hours.
column38:
過去幾年大學圖書館系統就為藝術系從日本東京株式會社二玄社及其他發行商訂購了好些製作水準極高的藝術複製品。這些作品的原件，目前屬台灣國立故宮博物院、上海博物館、大英博物館等的珍藏，而複本則以極精密的技術製成。印製之精美，仿真度之高，相信非專家也不容易辨別出來。

此批複製品現存於新亞書院錢穆圖書館，其中包括由唐朝至清朝的書畫，大部份並附解說釋文。由於價值昂貴，所以該批藏品只供研究之用，概不外借。為了讓讀者有機會欣賞這些藏品，錢穆圖書館的展覽塲展出部份藏品，歡迎讀者於錢穆圖書館開放時間內到塲參觀。

column37:
Art in Response - My Art Journey 
This is the fourth year for the School to take part in the Fine Art Asia, and it is the School's honor to continue to be the exclusive Education Partner of the Fine Art Asia for the third year.   Apart from sharing with the public works dedicatedly created by our students and alumni, the School is pleased to exchange with the public our views and philosophy on art education through a series of activities especially organized along the fair, including art demonstration activities, docent tours, seminar and interactive workshops corner. Gloria Yip Wan-yee and Philip Hui Kim-ho are the featured artists of the School this year.
column38:
以藝術作出回應──我的藝術之路
今年是學院連續四年參與典亞藝博，亦是第三年成為其教育伙伴。除了在展位展示多件由學院學生及校友精心創作的藝術品外，於典亞藝博舉行期間，我們將會舉辦一系列的活動，包括藝術示範、導賞團、學術講座，以及互動藝術工作坊，期望能與藝術愛好者，分享及交流學院於藝術教育之經驗和理念。葉蘊儀及許劍豪更是學院今年的重點藝術家。

column37:
Hong Kong Design Institute (HKDI) is a leading design education institution in Hong Kong under the VTC group providing quality education that cultivates knowledge, professionalism and new talents for the evolving creative industries.  It is committed to nurturing design talents with critical thinking, cultural sensitivity, social responsibility and an international perspective.

The programme of Higher Diploma of Architectural Design commenced in autumn 2012.  The first two cohorts of students will showcase their design work for the first time in public at this exhibition of FORM / SHIFT.

column29: School of Creative Media, City University of Hong Kong
column30: 香港城市大學創意媒體學院
column37:
http://antarctica.scm.cityu.edu.hk/  From 13 December 2013 until 3 January 2014, interdisciplinary teams of City University students from such fields as art, business, engineering, natural science, and social science conducted meaningful research in remote locations across Tierra del Fuego and the Antarctica continent. Using the tools and artistic resources of the School of Creative Media, they have developed new media art and design projects that utilize new presentation technologies to offer innovative approaches to understanding climate change and sustainable solutions.

The Extreme Environments programme promotes interdisciplinary research and discovery as an integral part of learning. The planet's most remote landscapes are among the most fragile and endangered. They offer unique insights into a sustainable future. This project brings together teams from across the academic spectrum to help better understand issues that threaten nature and our cities.
column38:
http://antarctica.scm.cityu.edu.hk/    2013年12月，香港城市大學的同學組成科藝研究團隊，遠赴南極極寒之地，祈為瞭解全球氣候轉變尋求新的解讀方式。
同學從南極帶回讓人驚歎的照片、映像及科學數據，同時亦揭示冰封大地傷痕累累的一面。本新媒體藝術展覽正是以同學帶回的研究資訊構築而成，參觀者將以全新角度體驗這片世上最荒蕪的大陸。

column37:
toof [ contemporary ] is proud to present the first Solo-Exhibition by Estonian Artist Gobotoru in Asia. 

Gobotoru’s first exhibition in Asia introduces a neo-noir inspired visual sensitivity and a mysterious Nordic Attitude to Hong Kong. Skillfully printed on Aluminum, the 17 Works by the Estonian artist are paired juxtaposing elaborate, at times haunting portraits (including the artists self-portrait) with timeless, yet meaningful land- and cityscapes, which speak of solitude and soothingly calm the soul. Each frame representing the piece of a puzzle, which collectively allow a glimpse into the artist’s world.

column37: Featuring a selection of old and never-to-be-seen new works, LAST YEAR is a further development of MA’s ongoing interest in the interpretation of history and the nature of historical knowledge. Anchoring around her eponym artwork Last Year, the exhibition feeds itself on both personal encounters and gazes of current and past events from the perspective of subjects who are actively or involuntarily involved in the unfolding of historical events.
column38: 馬氏創作的興趣範疇一直在於詮釋歷史和理解歷史知識的本質。展覽《去年》將延伸藝術家的興趣，除了部分挑選出來的舊作外，還會展出一系列新作。是次展覽將以與展覽同名的作品《去年》為中心， 捕捉了不同的個人經歷，以及身處於當前和過去事件中的不同眼神。藝術家從不同人的角度出發，不論相中人是自發的還是不自願地出現於歷史的洪流中 。

column19: Kacey Wong’s Art of Protest - Resisting Against Absurdity
column37:
Employing humour and sarcasm, the enquiries central to Wong’s practice around political issues are developed through installations and images as is his role in initiating, engaging and collaborating with the public in order to generate momentum in social discourse. Inspired by Hong Kong’s recent dramatic change in political climate, Wong considers the phenomenon of “Absurdity” in Hong Kong, our response to it and the nature of happiness. Resonating Camus’ observation that “at any streetcorner the feeling of absurdity can strike a man in the face” Wong acknowledges the contradiction between the desire for freedom from unreasonable authority and passive resistance or acceptance.
Wong plays a participatory performing role in public demonstrations including Hong Kong’s 1st of July Marches exploring the scope to bring radical change to society through art. As an artist Wong consciously subverts the assumption of productivism employing rather action, sculpture, situation, language and character generating a collection of creative encounters. For the duration of the exhibition the gallery will be occupied by the lifesize model tank which was employed by the artist in challenging the Hong Kong government’s plan to establish a “Cultural Bureau” – a plan that was eventually scrapped in the face of concerted opposition.

column19: Let's take a photo: Street people @different locations
column37: Tang Ying Chi, a visual artist is inviting you to take a picture with this anonymous person. The unknown person is one of the many figures painted from Tang's self-taken photographs in the streets of Hong Kong. The work is painted directly from digital projection on canvas and is further printed for display site-specifically. Here, Tang is introducing this stranger to you and encouraging you to find more about the person in the context of city development.
column38: 視覺藝術家鄧凝姿邀請你跟這位無名氏合拍一張照片。，這位不知名人物是鄧氏眾多從香港街道上自行抓拍所得、再繪畫的行人圖像之一。作品是在數碼投射的帆布上直接繪畫、然後打印，在特定現場中展示，鄧氏在這裡向你介紹這位陌生人、並鼓勵你從城市發展的脈絡中對他認識多一點。

column10: 九龍塘禧福道五號香港浸會大學傳理視藝大樓顧明均展覽廳
column37: Brandon Chan, a local artist and 2012 AVA graduate, invited fourteen primary school students to take part in a project. By facilitating a series of workshops, the kids were encouraged to observe daily scenes and objects, enabling them to reflect upon their relationship with daily life and creativity. They imagined and created hundreds of little creatures and reinterpreted the stories of objects.
column38: 本地藝術創作者陳百堅，為視覺藝術院2012年畢業生，邀請了十四位小學生，透過一連串工作坊， 從日常生活中一些微小的場境、大大小小的物件……藉著純粹而 細緻的觀察，他們發現了一隻又一隻莫名其妙的小生物。加上對生命的 想像，他們重新捕捉著每件物件所包容的情感而交織出一個個有趣的小故事。

column37: Paintings featured in “Mind-Scape II” exhibition are means to expand the inner dialogue between “Scenic painting” and “Landscape painting” — this “dialogue” is also a “comparison of drawings” for ink and oil painting, a “dialogue” between the East and West. In this exhibition, artists attempt to use their creations and rigorous explorations to open an in-depth dialogue between the spirits of ink painting, Western landscape and scenic painting and the subsequent progress towards abstraction. Hopefully, a possible new language for the contemporary Chinese art can be discovered.

column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37:
The exhibition is about “Time”. Lo Yuet-mei, who is now majoring photography in the Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme of the Hong Kong Art School, spent time on revisiting the house of her father and re-examining her father's stuffs.  She rediscovered the childhood memories and redefined the lives of the Second World War generation. 

In the series “My Father”, Yuet-mei is not just trying to remember her father, but using “the present” time to reconstruct the tiny fragments of her memories and to re-examine her “past”. In her second series “I”, Yuet-mei wants to express her subjective view on “Time”, the vertical progression of time.
column38:
在藝術學院藝術文學士課程主修攝影的羅月眉將時間用於重遊父親身前的居所及仔細翻查他的遺物；在發掘兒時回憶的同時，亦藉此感受二戰一代的生活面貎。
在《父親》系列中，她以當下的時間去重塑細碎的記憶片段，不為懷念而創作，而是作者對個人經歷的重塑。這種重塑進一步在藝術家展出的第二個系列《我》中加以發展。她認為一般人對時間的概念，被計算單位及時間軸所支配，是一種客觀而橫向的觀念。而她卻希望以主觀而縱向的觀念去看待時間。

column37: The joint solo exhibition “My Mum / My Father” features the new works of two Mainland Chinese photography artists: My Mum by Ren Hang (b. 1987), a rising star on contemporary Chinese art scene who encapsulates the country’s subculture in his provocative personal photography; and Father by Li Lang (b. 1969), one of China’s most important artists of documentary photography in recent years. In a contrasting showcase of Ren’s colourful and conceptually playful portraits of his mother, and Li’s emotive documentations of the life of his late father on which he hand-wrote 30,219 dates of the days his father lived, this exhibition reflects some of the intriguing and experimental facets of the two photographic forms.
column38: 雙個展“我的媽媽／我的父親”展出中國攝影藝術家任航及黎朗的新作品。創作《我的媽媽》的任航（b. 1987）一直以具挑逗性的私攝影描述今日中國次文化；而創作《父親》的黎朗（b. 1969）則是中國近年最重要的紀實攝影藝術家之一。任氏為母親拍攝色彩濃烈和充滿玩味的肖像，而黎氏則以感性記實的手法來紀念暮年父親，並在照片上手寫上30,219個他父親活過的日期，是次展覽揭示兩種攝影風格引人入勝和實驗性的面向。

column19: My Photo-Creative Photography Workshop and Exhibition
column20: 我影我心-創意攝影工作坊及展覽
column37:
Since 2011, Art in Hospital has been serving Early Psychosis young patients in the hospital to explore the possibility of photography.  Starting with photography, in addition with other forms of art, participants create their unique artworks so to sooth their emotion. Although they do not have superb photography skills and high-value equipment, they have the courage, and endless creativity, hoping to express their inner world through the creation.

This exhibition will present all the patients artwork created in these 3 years.
column38:
自2011年起，我們在數間醫院裡與思覺失調科的年青人病者，以不同的攝影器材及方法，探索攝影的可能性。以照片作為一個起點，加上其他藝術的表達形式，創作出獨特且富創意的作品，以抒緩他們在病中的情緒。雖然他們沒有高超的攝影技巧及價值高昂的器材，但他們有勇於嘗試的心，及無盡的創意，希望藉著創作去表達自己的內心世界。

是次展覽結集「我影我心」三年來的藝術作品，作為這個計劃的結束，讓觀眾一氣呵成地欣賞參加者的傑作。

column37:
100ft. PARK is pleased to present “MYOPIA”, installation by Jae Hyun Lim between January 17 – February 17, 2015, investigating human behavior under the intervention of temporary spatial setting on street level.
“MYOPIA” is a journey into the act of narrow-mindedness shaped by seeing our mind and body brought to its stillness.
The project begins with a spatial condition of transparent glass wall that separates two spaces; a gallery and street. Pedestrians often simply pass by the gallery. They notice something occasionally but not enough to change the course of their journey so they simply continue.
The objective here is to divert this pattern of relationship using the wall as a means of interacting with the streetscape. The intervention functions as a mediator that facilitates a scene in which our body becomes a part of performance of “seeing” or “being seen”.
column38:
《MYOPIA》是探索人的思考、觀察隨著身體和精神進入靜止狀態而變得狹窄的一個旅程。
藝術空間的一面玻璃把場地和街道分隔而形成的空間環境是是次裝置作品的靈感來源。途人往往與百呎公園擦身而過，甚少駐足停留。他們偶爾留意到空間內的活動，但也不足以改變他們的行程，只是繼續往前走。
裝置作品希望利用玻璃幕門作為與街道互動的介面，嘗試影響路人的行為習慣。這種空間的介入促使身體進入“觀看”和“被看”的場境。
作品由反光物料、取景器和標線組成，各元素組合起來製造出一個時空。裝置是暫時性的，跟它靜止的狀態成為對比，帶出所呈現的空間景象只是由一連串不明和流動的因素產生的瞬間。
愈靠近《MYOPIA》，觀看者的身體欲靜止下來，知覺卻隨著變得敏銳。觀看者調節身體行為以適應和理解作品的同時成為作品的一部分。

column19: Parallel Space: A New Matrix of Concept Photography in the Era of China’s Modernization
column20: 平行空間－中國現代歷程上的觀念攝影
column36: The project features photographic works of 35 artists from China and around the world discoursing about China in the last 25 years. It is about China’s infrastructural space and its associative/ psychological space, and about utopian space and its heterotopias/ dystopian space.
column37: 籌備廿五年的影像文化平臺《平行空間-中國現代化歷程上的覌念攝影(1)》，以原始的數學觀念展示了一種跟當下香港主流攝影展覽機制平行發展、迥然不同的文化研究和展示策略。展覽焦點地呈現一)過去廿五年以來中國金光耀眼的城市發展(法國Christophe Morin的Orange Shanghai Skyline…)，以及二)在都市化、全球化進展歷程上的城市沙石(南韓Oh Jin Sun的天安門…)作為兩條基本影像線索。

column9: Jockey Club Creative Arts Centre, Central Courtyard & L7-12A
column10: 賽馬會創意藝術中心中央庭園及L7-12A室
column19: Parallel Space: A New Matrix of Concept Photography In The Era of China's Modernization
column20: 平行空間 — 中國現代化下的當代攝影
column36: 白雙全、徐坦、洪浩、蒼鑫、戴光鬱、崔岫聞、楊志超、盧婉雯、Gerard Lang、蔣志、達達、姚瑞中、李銳奮、倪衛華、邵逸農、顏磊、汪建偉、王南溟、曾途、Sarawut Chutiwongpeti, Laurent Dequick,吳文正、馮文耀、朱迅等
column37: Parallel Space: A New Matrix of Concept Photography In The Era of China's Modernization is a project about China in the last 25 years. It is about China's infrastructural space and its associative/ psychological space, and about utopian space (Thomas More) and its heterotopias (Michel Foucault)/ dystopian space (J.S. Mill). In this 4D space of “Matrix” (X1-n x Y1-n x Z1-n x TTime). The visitors can review the photos by exploring the grand-narrative spaces between history and storytelling (i.e. the photos in the X-axis orchestrate the grand infrastructure of China), and the micro-private spaces between reality and expectation (i.e. the photos in the Y-axis hinge on artists’ mental response to China's modernization). Or, they can explore the issues revolving around all defined and undefined, harmonic or troubled time-space behind the photos (i.e. the Z-axis) and develop their own strategies of display, which may embody the passions of identity or dynamics of diaspora. Each space newly created can open up a period in time and a set of associations (i.e. the Time or T-axis are also spaces in transition, transformation or empty nowadays). The parallel spaces, which are the CPU of a matrix, are factional or fictional, illusionary or enigmatic; they embrace trajectories historical or temporal, social or personal. The project is open-ended and participatory in the sense that some 'blank spaces' can be opened up so that the covert vision of the public can be made overt as the visitors can relocate the photos to the desired locations themselves in between the parallel spaces. These are the citizen spaces created for reflection in the light of the “Great China Dream” or current politics in China.
column38: 籌備廿五年的影像文化平臺《平行空間-中國現代化歷程上的覌念攝影(1)》，以原始的數學觀念展示了一種跟當下香港主流攝影展覽機制平行發展、迥然不同的文化研究和展示策略。展覽焦點地呈現一)過去廿五年以來中國金光耀眼的城市發展(法國Christophe Morin的Orange Shanghai Skyline…)，以及二)在都市化、全球化進展歷程上的城市沙石(南韓Oh Jin Sun的天安門…)作為兩條基本影像線索。

column37: Tang Ying Chi, a visual artist is inviting you to take a picture with this anonymous person. The unknown person is one of the many figures painted from Tang's self-taken photographs in the streets of Hong Kong. The work is painted directly from digital projection on canvas and is further printed for display site-specifically. Here, Tang is introducing this stranger to you and encouraging you to find more about the person in the context of city development.
column38: 視覺藝術家鄧凝姿邀請你跟這位無名氏合拍一張照片。，這位不知名人物是鄧氏眾多從香港街道上自行抓拍所得、再繪畫的行人圖像之一。作品是在數碼投射的帆布上直接繪畫、然後打印，在特定現場中展示，鄧氏在這裡向你介紹這位陌生人、並鼓勵你從城市發展的脈絡中對他認識多一點。

column37: Artify Gallery is proud to present Seascape the second solo exhibition of Malaysian photographer Eiffel Chong, in Hong Kong. The exhibition showcases Chong’s photographic series of seascapes captured along Asia’s coastline. Documenting the peaceful chasm that delineates sea from land, public from private and human from the wild. Chong forges a dialogue about the coexistence of human beings with nature, represented by an unfathomable ocean that engulfs the continent. Seascape is the second of Chong’s exhibition Artify Gallery presents, after its inaugural exhibition in 2012. The exhibition runs from 22 January – 05 March, 201

column37: "SLOW and LIVING POP-UP EXHIBITION" was a one-day exhibition coordinated by students of the School's Higher Diploma in Applied and Media Arts programme on 16/4/2014 at the School's Chai Wan Campus. Through the use of new media art, the students express their thoughts on the relationship between new technology and social interactions.

column37:
Kwok has invited local artist Lam Tung-pang to serve as a case study for the exhibition, and she highlights Lam's experiences in developing
his career in order to investigate the relationship between contemporary artists, galleries and collectors. She also showcases “Take Home
and Make Real the Priceless In Your Heart”, a series of paintings of crystals by Liu Ding that the artist has commissioned to his precise
specifications. With his signature – a symbol of value and authority – affixed on the back of each painting, the complete work seemingly
transforms the reproductions into priceless collectibles of a renowned artist and thus invites viewers to reflect on the value of a work of art:
is a collector investing in the work itself or in the future potential of the artist? Also presented in the exhibition is “One Square Foot of Sky” by
foreign investment (FI), a collective initially formed by foreign artists. For this work, they have teamed up with four young Hong Kong artists –
Chris Huen Sin-kan, Kong Wing, Dakuen Leung and Wong Ka-ying – to paint the Hong Kong sky above us into “sky shares”, the value of which
is based on the price of property in the district. FI connects their art with daily life to provide a new criterion for considering the price of art.
Encouraging critical thinking and initiating effective discussions around the value of art, the project adopts a “club membership” approach to
act as an incubator for a committed audience to further their knowledge and engagement. A series of activities will continue to be held during
the exhibition period to stimulate a debate between the curator, the guest speakers, the exhibiting artists and the public on the development
and collection of art.
column38:
郭瑛邀請了香港藝術家林東鵬作為一個個案，以他建立藝術事業的經歷，探討當代藝術家與畫廊及收藏家的
關係。另一位參展藝術家劉鼎為我們展示他委約他人複製的水晶石組畫，他於每張畫背後加上了象徵價值
及權威的藝術家簽名，成為作品《帶回家實現心中的無價》，彷彿把複製的畫作瞬間變成了無價的名作，劉
鼎讓觀眾思考藝術品的價值，究竟收藏家投資的是作品本身還是藝術家的未來潛力？《一平方尺的天空》
是藝術組合 foreign investment 的作品，組合由四位海外成員聯同四位香港年青藝術家：禤善勤、江永、打
權及黃嘉瀛組成。他們以水彩繪畫香港的天空，並以樓價作為股價參考指標，製作成「天空股票」。foreign
investment把生活與作品連結起來，為藝術定價提供一個新的考量。
為鼓勵觀眾對「藝術的價值」作深入的思考，這個計劃特別設有「會員制」，展覽期間亦舉辦一連串活動，
鼓勵公眾與客席策展人、藝術家及講者一同參與有關藝術發展及收藏的討論。

column35: Tang Ying Chi, Harold de Puymorin, San Chiu Yan
column37:
Hong Kong has experienced much ups and downs in recent years, from celebrations to conflicts, from clarity to confusion, from questions about identity to questions about belonging. 

Through it all, the city we call home is in its most raw existence… still Hong Kong.

Still Hong Kong is a cross medium exhibition, and will showcase a trio artists telling the Hong Kong story each in their own unique ways. 

They also reflect the city’s increasingly diverse mix of multigenerational, heritage, and upbringing of our city's creative talents.
column38:
近年的香港，經歷眾多大大少少、林林總總的起伏、衝突；但歷盡再多的變化，這個地方，還是帶著一貫舊有的《香港依然》。

三位來自五湖四海的藝術家，以跨媒體形式，憶述他們眼中屬於香港的不同故事。藝術家分別來自本地及海外，但各自都對香港的藝術發展有著不同的看法。

column37: Featuring 23 sets of works from the collections of Mrs Tong King-sum the Hong Kong Heritage Museum and Hong Kong Museum of Art , this exhibition aims to pay tribute to Tong King-sum, a well-respected forerunner whose achievements mirror those of local artists.

column9: Gallery, Academy of Visual Arts, Kai Tak Campus, 51 Kwun Tong Road Kowloon, HK
column10: 九龍觀塘道51號啟德校園香港浸會大學視覺藝術院畫廊
column35: Onna Yeung, Josphine Lui and Molly Lun
column37:
People tend to restraint themselves, in order to keep their wishes and desires under control, or to conceal impulses, thoughts and emotions that are not generally accepted by the society.

As a group act by three emerging artists – Molly Lun, Onna Yeung and Josephine Lui, the exhibition aim at viewing constraints in all sorts of different angles in relationship of self and others, which reflect one's different levels of negotiation within these “frames” – Lun examined the social situations of female smokers by taking photographs of them; Yeung built an installation to reconstruct the confined bodily experience to be both an intimate relationship and domestic environment; and Lui looking inward to her very own self, questioning her own existence by painting and sculpting portrait of herself.

With their works of photography, paintings and installation art, the artists each represent their exploration through their source of constraints from the society, an intimate relationship, and one self. Attempting to connect and associate to the audiences, the artists tried to provoke them with reflections of the suppression in life.
column38:
每個人都有壓抑願望或慾望，或隱藏不被接受的衝動、思想或情感的時候，展覽「囚」旨在表達人受制於框架之中的情景。三位年輕藝術家以不同角度切入種種在自我與他人之間的關係，體現她們在生活中與這些「框架」不同程度的交涉。倫訟文透過記錄女性煙民與她們呼出的煙圈探討她們的處境；楊安娜以手造傢俱重塑在親密關係與家庭環境約束下的身體經驗；雷康寧則以繪畫及雕塑嘗試向內在的自我進行一系列謁問。

藝術家們透過這些攝影、繪畫及裝置藝術作品，再現他們各自在受社會、兩性關係及自身施加於個體的壓抑，與及闡述種種束縛與自我解放的過程，以期刺激觀眾意識到生活的束縛，並思考這些制約對他們的影響。

column19: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School Exhibition—Ding Dong
column20: 香港藝術學院藝廊展覽──叮咚
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column35: Sin Wai-chi, Lai Wing-ki, Koon Tak-kwan
column37:
“Ding Dong” is a sound of the doorbell.  It is also the connection point of people. 
In this exhibition, Sin Wai-chi, Lai Wing-ki and Koon Tak-kwan, three graduates of the Hong Kong Art School's Higher Diploma in Fine Art programme (majoring in Sculpture), will share different ideas of “home”, and welcome everyone to go into their private creative world.  At the same time, there will be a cooperative artwork shown in this exhibition.
column38: 「叮咚」是門鈴的聽音，也是人與人之間的一種連繫。這次展覽，冼慧芝、黎穎琪、管德鈞，三位香港藝術學院藝術高級文憑課程的畢業生（主修雕塑），會與觀眾分享對「家」的不同想像,邀請觀眾進入藝術家私密的創作世界。三位藝術家亦會合力完成一件作品，並於展覽同時展出。

column19: The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: Dunhuang – Untold Tales, Untold Riches
column20: 香港賽馬會呈獻系列：敦煌 ― 說不完的故事
column29:
Presented by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department, Dunhuang Academy
Organised by the Hong Kong Heritage Museum
column30:
康樂及文化事務署、敦煌研究院
香港文化博物館籌劃
column37: This exhibition showcases nearly 120 artefacts that represent all the core aspects of Dunhuang grotto art and fully demonstrate the vast diversity of Dunhuang culture. Highlights include three replica caves, a 13-metre-long statue of the Nirvāṇa Buddha, wooden movable type in Uighur script, Buddhist sūtras written in Tibetan script, The Book of Psalms written in Syriac script, the only extant printed copy in the world of Essential Mantras in Tangut script and copies of the cave murals produced by the founding pioneers of the National Dunhuang Art Institute (precursor of the Dunhuang Academy), including Mr Chang Shuhong and Mr Duan Wenjie.
column38: 是次的展品近120件/套，囊括了敦煌石窟主體的主要內容類別，充份顯示了敦煌文化所涉及的廣闊層面。重點展品包括三個具代表性的複製洞窟、長達近13米的涅槃佛像、回鶻文木活字粒、古藏文經卷、敘利亞文聖經、海內外僅存的西夏文經咒要語，以及國立敦煌藝術研究所（敦煌研究院前身）開拓者常書鴻先生及段文傑先生等人的壁畫臨摹作品等。

column37: Tam Hing Kai, a graduate of the Hong Kong Art School's Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme (majoring in Photography) wants to directly record his feelings towards his sick grandmother through the method of Intimate Photography in his solo exhibition, "Tree and Wind". Tam Hing Kai has been living with his grandmother since he was a child until she passed away two years ago. He would like to commemorate his late grandmother in the upcoming exhibition which will end on 4 April, one day before the Ching Ming Festival.
column38: 「樹與風」是譚慶楷─香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程畢業生(主修攝影)以攝影機為工具，嘗試直接地記錄他對患病中祖母的感受，照片中充滿感覺。如果那些照片同樣能在您的心靈中產生回響的話，那可能正就是拍攝者的感受。譚氏自小與祖母同住直到她離世前兩年。每年清明時節總會有很多人帶着各樣的鮮花、祭品，祭祖掃墓，以表達對先人懷念之情。今次展期由三月十一日至四月四日，就是今年清明節前一天結束。

column37:
Under Pressure features the latest collection of ink drawings and photographs by Hong Kong artist and poet Claire Lee.
The series is a continuation of Claire Lee’s research-based art practice, this time exploring the theme of ‘pressure’. During her research, the artist was profoundly touched and inspired by her readings about people suffering from different degrees of pressure from body anomalies to depression or mental disorders.
For Claire Lee, where pressure is taking place, life manifests a great survival desire and energy, which she depicts in simple yet intense artworks. They express the tension between harmony and violence, inherent to all human, animal and natural forms. The exhibition invites visitors to discover in insignificant forms the most powerful manifestation of beauty itself.

column37:
Nowadays Hong Kong is flooded with different discourses.
Various information bombards us in the daily living.
The same event could be told in various “Truth”.

With such vast amount of information, communication among people is no doubt mixed with various impurities. Although the conversation is still happening, due to the unclearness and incorrectness of the message, such dialogue is same as naught. 

There should not be anything hidden under the sun, yet in nowadays Hong Kong, those belief and truth once has been treasured, has now all become merely a urban legend.
column38:
當下的香港充斥着各式各樣的論述，
每天被轟炸着不同的資訊；
每天被描摹着不同的真實。

如以這些資訊為談話基礎，對話中內容便會摻雜不純， 或誇大或淡化。 
內容雖然未必是並不真實，但因訊息頓時不清晰不正確，
儘管通話仍然在，通信其實猶如中斷，漸漸的或化訛或化譌。 

日光之下本應無新事，然而活在當下的香港，
有些曾被相信的信念，事實都變成了都市傳說了。

column37: Ben Brown Fine Arts is honoured to present the second solo exhibition in Hong Kong of new works by Vik Muniz.  The exhibition features his recent Album and Postcards from Nowhere series for which the artist obsessively collected vintage photographs and postcards and then shredded and collaged these highly intimate relics to create bold new imagery magnified to a staggering scale.  The works offer a meditation on the personal versus the collective, the precious versus the ephemeral, nostalgia and modernity.  Muniz is renowned for his ingenious employment of unusual materials, including dust, sugar, chocolate, diamonds, caviar, toys, paper hole-punches, junk, dry pigment and magazine shreds, to reconstruct images that tap into the viewer’s subconscious visual repository and beg for further investigation.
column38: Ben Brown Fine Arts畫廊幸蒙委託，將為維克‧穆尼斯 (Vik Muniz) 的全新力作在香港推出第二場個展。這次展出的是他近期的《無名影集與明信片》(Album and Postcards from Nowhere) 系列：穆尼斯收集老照片和明信片成癖，他將這些極為私人的紀念品弄碎，將之拼湊成大膽創新的圖像，再放大成驚人的巨幅。該批作品反思了個人與集體、代代相傳與曇花一現、懷舊與現代等對立的概念。眾所週知，穆尼斯擅於利用別具一格的素材，如灰塵、糖菓、巧克力、鑽石、玩具、紙打孔器、舊破爛、乾顏料和碎雜誌，將之重塑為能激活觀眾潛意識中的視覺寶藏和發人深省的圖像。

column29: Presented by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department and the Hong Kong Designers Association
column30: 康樂及文化事務署與香港設計師協會
column37: We are undertaking the past criteria of Triennial which is in line with the recommendations of the International Council of Graphic Design Associations. The four categories in the competition – Ideology, Promotion of Cultural Events, Commercial and Advertising, and Thematic – "Blind Spot" - attracted 1,556 works, an impressive total, which represents the diverse creativity of 518 designers, companies and groups hailing from 32 countries or regions and provides a comprehensive overview of the latest global trends in poster design.
column38: 承接過往四屆三年展的準則，比賽按照國際平面設計社團協會的指引進行，分為「意識形態」、「文化活動推廣」、「商業與廣告」及今屆特設的「專題 — 盲點」共四大組別。今屆共有來自32個國家/地區共518位設計師、公司及組合參賽，提交的1,556份作品反映不同地區的獨特文化和海報設計的特色。

column37: Wang Keping is one of China's foremost sculptors. His work defies definition. Inspired in his early years by masters of European Modernist and African sculpture, his search today stems from Zen or Buddhist ideas of simplicity and nature, material and the non-material, physical and spiritual. Through his bestial erotic forms and swirling lines he works with a language of natural intuition of space and object, collaborating with his material and the secrets it has to reveal.

column20: 編織人生路《SAORI美麗新世界大展第二回》
column29: Centre for Community Cultural Development, BYY.B. Expostore, SAORI
column30:
社區文化發展中心,
BYY.B. EXPOSTORE,
SAORI
column36:
來自日本的SAORI 手織藝術 (SAORI Weaving) 創立人城美紗鷗老太太，於40多年前創立SAORI手織藝術，用新的思維方法，提倡「不教不練只引導，無樣板亦無針法。尋找自我，放膽冒險。」讓自我表現能得到實現，不受拘束，依據自己喜歡的樣子，自由奔放地编織。

SAORI編織是特別的藝術，強調個性，和機器大量生產的布疋大大不同。SAORI同時重視感性，銳意把感性運用到手工編織之中。此外，SAORI亦致力支援殘疾人士的藝術發展、協助發展中國家的殘疾人士，為他們創造就業機會和開發編織製成品的市場，令他們在社會上、經濟上自立。
 
根據日本的經驗，SAORI手織，尤其吸引自閉症人士，當今著名的SAORI  Creator，如大崎裕久先生及濱口友和先生，均為自閉症人士，他們接觸了SAORI，被SAORI手織的創意和自由奔放所迷到，將SAORI手織溶入生命之中。作品之多，作品之美，是普通人不能做到的，令人感動，令人讚嘆...

column19: "DANCE" photography exhibition curated by Eugenia Grandchamp des Rauz
column37: agnès b.s’ LIBRAIRIE GALERIE is delighted to present DANCE, a solo photography exhibition by the French artist, Eugenia Grandchamp des Raux. A series of photographs that captures the ballet dancers of the Opéra de Paris in the Monde-Flou (World of blur) is being shown in the exhibition to express the artist’s great passion for dance. “World of blur” is the continuation of movement, the representation of vibration and even a part of life. The photographs reflect her deep desire to restore the snapshots of still images to movement and share the dreams behind.

column37: The concept of “transitopia” comes from the book of the writer Dung Kai-cheng Atlas: “endless cycles, restless journey, always in transition and never reaching the destination – "transitopia" is where the transition itself becomes the destination.” There is vertical and horizontal transition. Vertical transition in terms of time – memory of the past, the present moment, future development. In architecture conservation, it also means a certain degree of change. Horizontally, it means the place; exchange and collaboration between the two places and cities. In the cultural industry, especially areas like publishing, film, music and visual arts, Hong Kong and Taiwan exchanges a lot of their products and ideas, and collaborate for cultural creation. Always in transition? It is Hong Kong. It is Taipei.
column38: 「轉易地」來自作家董啟章的著作《地圖集》：「循環往復，悠轉不息，永遠在過渡的動作中，而沒法到達過渡的目的地，transitopia， 就是以過渡本身為目的的地方」這種轉易可以是縱向的，也可以是橫向的。縱向是時間上的—過去的記憶、當下的生活、未來的發展， 就建築而言算是保育建築，亦標誌着一定程度的轉變；橫向可以是兩地之間的合作交流。 在文化產業方面，尤其是出版、電影、音樂及視覺藝術，兩地往來甚多，合作不斷。永遠在過渡中？香港如是，台北如是。

column37: “After Blossom” is a new kinetic video installation work extended from previous work of Chloe “The Burst of Pleasure”. Enchanted by the sensation that the burst of bubbles and balloons arouses, Chloe would like to further explore the material of soap bubble and its implication for her lived experience.  Chloe associates the shadow of leaves blown by the wind with soap bubbles to express the peacefulness following a chaotic period in her life; Chloe invites the audience to feel the work together with a little poem.

column19: 15 Invitations—a short history of the art book bag ( and the things that go in them)
column35:
Contributors include Dan Graham, Jonathan Monk, and Yoko Ono for Art Metropole, Toronto, C&G for Asia Art Archive and Silas Fong, Hong Kong, Rirkrit Tiravanija for DIS and Liz Magic Laser, New York, East of Borneo, Los Angeles, Haegue Yang and Lawrence Weiner for Latitudes, Barcelona, and Takashi Murakami for Louis Vuitton among many others.

Chu also invites such artists, curators, art book fair organisers, and print and online publishers as Stacey Allan, Executive Editor, East of Borneo, Savannah Gorton, Curator, Friends with Books and Co-Director & Curator, Forever & Today, Inc., Christina Li, Director, Spring Workshop, David Senior, Bibliographer, The Museum of Modern Art, and others to provide insight into the changing modes of knowledge production and circulation, and their influence on the recent art of Asia through Field Notes.
column36:
展出多名藝術家與不同機構合作製作的書袋，包括 Dan Graham 與 Art Metropole（多倫多）、C&G 與亞洲藝術文獻庫（香港）、Rikrit Tiravanija 與 DIS（紐約）及 East of Borneo （洛杉機）、Haegue Yang 及 Lawrence Weiner 與 Latitudes（巴塞隆拿）、村上隆與路易威登等。

朱珮瑿邀請藝術家、策展人、藝術書展籌劃人、印刷及線上書藉出版人參與，包括 Stacey Allan（《East of Borneo》執行編輯）、Savannah Gorton （Friends with Books 策展人、Forever & Today, Inc. 聯合總監及策展人）、David Senior（紐約現代藝術博物館書誌學者）及李綺敏（Spring 工作室總監），一同解讀正在轉變的知識生產及流通模式，以及這種模式如何影響亞洲近代藝術發展，項目成果將刊登於《搜記》。
 
《15份邀請》的其他參與者包括 Zoe Butt、Inti Guerrero、胡昉及張偉、Marysia Lewandowska、Walid Raad、Rashid Rana、楊嘉輝以及亞洲藝術文獻庫成員等。

column17: Chinese Painting, Calligraphy and Seal Carving
column37: The exhibition will display an album painted by Huang Yongyu and the funerary potteries from Han and Tang Dynasties depicted in the album. They reflect the burial customs of the period, as well as the prevailing social customs and livelihoods. With the album as a prelude, we will observe the interaction between paintings and artifacts, and sincere friendship between collector and artist.
column38: 是次展出畫冊「展堂一鱗」以及黃永玉所繪畫冊當中的七件珍貴漢唐明器，從中瞭解厚葬之風俗的盛行，展示了當時的社會民生。故以畫冊為引子，與文物和應，見證着一段繪畫與文物間的互動，和收藏家與畫家間交往的真摯情誼。

column19: A Room with A View – Her-Hong Kong-stories through the lens of six female artists
column20: 境遇之間 – 六個女性藝術家以攝影書寫的香港故事
column35: Lam Wai-kit, Lau Wai, Law Yuk-mui, Lo Yuen-man Yvonne, Wong Wo-bik, Yiu Miu-lai Joe
column36: 林慧潔，劉衛，羅玉梅，盧婉雯，王禾璧，姚妙麗
column37: On the surface there seems to be equal status between men and women in Hong Kong; nevertheless, due to various historical and social factors, the photography field is still dominated by men. The subjectivity of female photographers hasn’t been recognized. In showing the photographic works of six female artists aspire to give prominence to the subjectivity of Hong Kong female artists and, accordingly, look for Hong Kong’s historical identity through the lens of the female photographers.
column38: 香港社會的男女地位，表面擬似平等；然而，由於種種歷史和社會因素，香港的攝影領域中，依然出現男性主導的局面。女性攝影師的主體性，並未受到彰顯。《境遇之間》，就是希望透過展出六位女性藝術家的攝影作品，突現香港女藝術家的主體性，並從而尋找女性攝影師鏡頭下的香港歷史身份。

column19: A Solo Exhibition by Cheung Yee
column37: At the wise age of 79 Cheung Yee is not exactly a newcomer in the Hong Kong art scene. He is a colleague to many artist friends and as a professor of fine art at the Chinese University has been a mentor to many of Hong Kong’s younger generation. Cheung graduated in 1958 and has been working since on an oeuvre of sculptures and paintings in a style very unique to his own. His work has been featured with a solo exhibition not less than an unprecedented three times at the Hong Kong Museum of Art.

column37: “About My Hometown” features six latest photography and mixed media series from the award-winning Mainland Chinese artist Zhang Xiao. The exhibition highlights Zhang’s shifting focus from the portrayal of life in contemporary China in his previous series such as Coastline (2009-2013) and They (2006-2008) to reflections on his homecoming to Yantai, and the experiences and presences that surround it in his new works. It also demonstrates his use of a wider range of medium such as collage, sound and installation in his creative repertoire.
column38: “關於故鄉”展出曾三度獲獎的中國藝術家張曉的6套攝影及混合媒介作品。是次展覽展示出張曉在題材上的轉變，從舊作《海岸線》（2009-2013）和《他們》（2006-2008）展現了他對中國當代生活面貌的關注，至新作品中反思他回到故鄉煙台的經驗和現實。新作品亦體現了張氏採用攝影以外的媒介如拼貼、聲道及裝置於其創作中。從形態不停轉換的文化及娛樂、人對美學和現代化的認知，以至荒誕的社會制度，張氏的新作品雖來自自身的經驗和童年記憶，同時又反映了國家不斷經歷的變化和其人民的生活狀態，其感染力固之伸延。

column36: 陳曉肜，陳柏泉，張文才，張子軒，賴韋林，劉彥秋，丁可兒，黃嘉瀛，黃欣賢
column37: In 2012, the Choi Yee Co. Ltd plaque was removed from unit 814, Block B, Wah Luen Industrial Centre, Fotan, and nine occupants along with two dogs left to branch out into new chapters of life.  Because of particular, unusual characteristics, these nine people were once identified as what one might consider outsiders or social outcasts. But who is there to say that the outcasts cannot have their own mysterious group? To this day, we have remained friends for six years; there is without a doubt, an understanding and acceptance of the others behaviors and individuality that still prevails.  Our first exhibition as a group was held when we lived under the same roof as roommates, and so the works naturally reflected similar tastes and ideas. Now, three years later, we gather again with the hope to see how our paths diverged over time while also recognizing that there is still long road ahead. As we become better judges of character with time, can we remind each other of the person we once were, or discover new characteristics in the person we are becoming?  We used video format as the medium in our previous exhibition, and again this time, to document our reality, unfold sentiments, and visually construct new perspectives of one another.

column35: Leung Mee-ping, Chow Chun-fai, and the CoLAB x SLOW art group
column36: 梁美萍、周俊輝及創作團隊 CoLAB × 好地地
column37:
The exhibition "All Are Guests" reveals complex and dynamic host-guest relationships through different media and features works by artists Leung Mee-ping, Chow Chun-fai, and the CoLAB x SLOW art group. The exhibition was very well-received in its participation in the Liverpool Biennial 2012 in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong Week 2013 in Taipei. The Museum brings this exhibition back to Hong Kong to share with local audiences the artists' creativity and achievements.

Leung Mee-ping focuses her lens on drifters roaming in several Asian cities and expresses her concerns about marginalised social groups while exploring the identity of urban visitors. Chow Chun-fai reconstructs official trailers about Hong Kong and ponders the expectations of local residents and travellers of a city. CoLAB x SLOW is a cross-disciplinary collaboration that intervenes in an art exhibition with "a social enterprise project", blurring the subject-object roles in the art world to provoke thoughts.
column38:
「身是客」展覽展出藝術家梁美萍、周俊輝及創作團隊 CoLAB × 好地地通過不同形式的作品檢視當代社會複雜多變的主客關係。這個項目先後參與了2012年在英國舉辦的第七屆利物浦雙年展及2013年在台北舉行的第二屆「香港週」，均在當地大獲好評。今次藝術館將展覽帶回香港，希望與香港觀眾分享藝術家的創作成果。

梁美萍以錄像作品追蹤亞洲城市的流浪者，探問誰是過客，展現對邊緣族群的關注。周俊輝透過將一些香港的宣傳短片重塑與整合，思考本地人與訪客對城市的期望。CoLAB × 好地地的跨界別合作，以「社企項目」介入藝術展覽，令主與客身分在創作的領域模糊化，引發反思。

column37:
The world can be perceived in different ways, depending on each person’s perspective. Local artist Ms Tsang Ye-ye expresses her distinctive viewpoint by capturing dramatic juxtapositions between objects, light and shadows in the latest MTR "arttube" exhibition entitled "Another Reality".
From today (14 June 2015) to 2 August 2015, visitors to the "arttube" at MTR Central Station (Entrance/Exit J) will be able to appreciate 29 emotional and romantic oil and acrylic canvas paintings created by Ms Tsang that bring out the hidden magic in everyday existence as she sees it.

column38:
《ART.FAB.LAB 藝術．製造所》以製造所作為展覽。
這不只是開放讓人參觀數位製造的實驗室。從數位製造的硬件、空間，如何建構成藝術家們的創作場所、駐場藝術家的創作過程，以至作品完成展出、遇上不同的人，所有這些都是展覽的展品﹣展出的， 是一種經驗，是一種後數位製造時代所帶來的創作過程。

column37: Ben Brown Fine Arts Hong Kong is proud to present Aspects of German Art (Part One), a comprehensive survey of German post-war and contemporary art, featuring works by some of the most important and pioneering artists working in Germany during this period. The exhibition brings together seminal paintings, photographs and installations that provide an overview of the artistic, socio-economic and political concerns of post-war Germany, a time period when these artists were reconciling with the trauma of war, finding a national identity and constantly pushing the limits of modern and contemporary art, through to the present day.

column37: Drawing on his personal experience and following his distinctive curatorial line and interest in mixing disciplines and generations, the young Hong Kong curator conceived a group exhibition featuring one of his sound works, a video by Jolene Mok, an installation by sculptor Foon Sham, and specially made traditional paper crafts by Amanda Cheng of Soul House (Paper Art) Design Studio.

column37: The title of the exhibition “Beyond Babel” comes from a story from Genesis 11:1-9 of the Tower of Babel, and suggests the merging of language and symbol, and a homogenous system of recognition. The story of Babel explains how the variation in human languages came about. According to the story, when God found out that people were building a tower that would reach heaven and make a name for themselves which would only lead them away from God, He thwarted their plans by scattering the people all over the face of the earth. Professor Pan Yaochang wrote that the word Babel “has connotations of confusion in language. So out of Babel, or in other words, Beyond Babel, means to overcome the obstacles of different languages, and realize the common understandings amongst different cultures.”

column19: Bouie Choi Yuk kuen- The Breathing Room
column37: Bouie Choi Yuk-kuen's series of The Breathing Room presents to the audience a surrealistic collage filled with contextual information. She has chosen acrylic on paper as her primary medium which creates a dreamy atmosphere. Connection to her earlier works is evident. The delicate use of acrylic paint softens the edges and contour and that each motif appears integrated into the background. The juxtaposition of animals, human, trees and machines are dominant themes in her newest works. They appear in layers and parallels but never seem to contradict each others.

column19: Bubble Instants: Catkaling's Exhibition of Award-Winning Bubble Photos
column20: Bubble Instants: Catkaling's Exhibition of Award-Winning Bubble Photos
column37:
Visibly invisible, bubbles flutter about. In their dreamy spectrum of colours, images come into view: a very wise fellow with a flabby belly, a holy elephant and a Chinese Goddess… In the blink of an eye, POOF – all the bubbles are gone!

This is an exhibition of Catkaling's one-shot bubble photos, featuring two award-winning photo-poems, 'Bubble Instants' and 'Brushstrokes'. Let’s think of the life of a bubble. Let’s think of the bubble-like instants in our lives!

column35: Fu Baoshi, Wu Guanzhong, Sanyu and more
column36: 傅抱石、吳冠中、常玉及更多
column37: “CHINESE ART INSPIRING THE WORLD” showcases two extraordinary paintings: The God of Cloud and Great Lord of Fate and The Zhou Village by Chinese art maestros Fu Baoshi and Wu Guanzhong. The content of works are the starting point of affection, concealing the artists’ delicate emotions and thoughts- the language of ink deepens the infectant power, writing brushes and ink cause uproar of the unique Chinese sense and rhyme and the Oriental temperament overflow the paintings. Chinese art and culture infect and impress the world. The exhibition will also showcase a painting by renowned modern Chinese artist Sanyu created in 1956 titled Vase of Flowers in Blue and highlights from the Poly Auction Hong Kong 2016 Spring Auction.

column38: 「無話可說」的原因，一是對現實無奈的反應，二是需要假借寓言寄託不能直言的，三是因為寄語一個有距離的側面，能更準確描繪眼前的。展覽分為三個部份：第一部份描繪的是來自手提電話 WhatsApp、Facebook、WeChat 等傳來的圖像。這些從媒體或社交平台收集的圖像數量很多，我決定以紙本繪畫。而選取的故事大都是關於欺騙與被騙。第二部份是我較為人熟悉的「電影繪畫」系列。這次從電影選取一些暗示今天社會政治的畫面與對白，如電影《讓子彈飛》原本就充滿象徵性的場景，觀眾不停猜測其中的隱喻意義。如第一部份作品，故事同樣多關於欺騙與被騙。第三部份我想借用北韓金正恩的形象來造一件混合媒材的作品。全球流傳著他的圖像和視頻，那些百姓情緒高漲的哭臉、奔向偶像的肢體動作，在我來說這些畫面甚至具有文藝復興宗教繪畫的意味。

CINEMA 2.0 玻璃之城：媒體藝術展覽 
暨 第二十一屆 ifva 比賽媒體藝術組入圍作品展
column35: Julian Oliver ( New Zealand,  Germany), Björn Schülke (Germany), Adam Harvey (USA)
column38: 現代人生活中，事無大小都「被監控」﹕從閉路電視、手機衛星定位追蹤到Facebook上的人臉偵測功能等等，統統都讓人無所遁形，這一切可能跟電影也有關。 今年媒體藝術年度展CINEMA 2.0則以此為題，ifva 繼續聯同art.ware，展出三位海外媒體藝術家Julian Oliver (紐西蘭/德國)、Adam Harvey (美國) 及Björn Schülke (德國) 之作品，與觀眾一同探究表面上毫無關聯的電影與監控兩者之間的微妙關係。同場展出第二十一屆ifva比賽媒體藝術組，來自南韓、中國、日本、臺灣及香港共十份入圍作品。媒體藝術組得獎結果將於是次開幕中率先揭曉，藝術家分享於4:30pm舉行。

column37:
In 2013, Mur Nomade’s curator Amandine Hervey invited Claire Lee and Régis Gonzalez to embark on a conversation exclusively conducted by postal mail. At that time, they were living respectively in Hong Kong and Saint Etienne, France, and were simply given a name and a mailing address as starting point.

Claire Lee and Régis Gonzalez have been corresponding through texts, drawings, photographs and small fabricated objects over the past years. In this long-distance discussion, the two artists have explored in metaphoric ways feelings of being stranded and pressured, but they also tinted their dialogue with sporadic references to events of their daily lives.

The objects exchanged by the two artists will be presented on Mur Nomade's booth at Art Central as a collaborative installation, complementing Claire Lee's series Under Pressure.
column38:
始於2013年, 策展人Amandine Hervey邀請藝術家李美蓮與Régis Gonzalez通過信件進行交流對話。剛開始時，兩位藝術家分別居住在香港和法國聖艾蒂安，當時他們僅知道對方的名字以及通信地址 。

兩位藝術家在過去的幾年間，不斷用文字、圖畫、影像以及自製的小物件進行通信。在這種遠距離的討論中，兩位藝術家以隱喻的方式，探索困頓以及壓力，但同時他們也運用日常生活中的事件作為零散的參考，為他們之間的對話著色。

這些來自兩位藝術家交流的物件，將會作為共同創作的藝術裝置，聯同李美蓮的Under Pressure系列在Art Central的 Mur Nomade展廳中展出。

column37:
Again, we are talking about “Hong Kong”. Hong Kong, Hong Kong. Some people call Hong Kong a “Shoppers’ Paradise”, some call her a “Foodies’ Paradise”, or according to some, a “concrete jungle”. Yet, no stories are more genuine than personal experience, to most Hong Kongers, the city is a home, where they live in and grow with every day.

City inspires observation, opinions and imagination. Writers may put these thoughts into essays and poems, musicians may create music, film makers may take videos and upload them to YouTube, and some busy buddies would simply write a brief feed or a long note on their Facebook wall. Now in Comixhibition and the City, comics and illustration artists choose drawings to tell their own stories.

column37:
Contemporary culture is not only the heritage of traditional habits; more than that, it tends to be the lifestyles that form when people choose and realise their values. The cultural landscape inhabits a particular geographic region, in order to meet people’s needs for social development and to build the scenes of their daily lives. It represents these people’s spiritual home. It is the overlapping history of the life of people and things, in a certain space and time. Since 1997, a very special period in the history of Hong Kong, the cultural landscape has witnessed the social transformation of the implementation of “One Country, Two Systems”, and has undergone many changes in the local cultural contexts.

Hong Kong has long been immersed in the modern artistic cultural contexts of the transcendent new ink art. Since 1997, a new generation of artists has applied art in social life. Hong Kong art, along with the pulses of social process, has produced new vitality. Artists such as Wong Shun-kit and Chau Shik-hong are the backbone of this art movement. They use artistic images, from different perspectives and in different ways, to interpret the historic fragments of a modern city and to track its social transformation into a dilemma.

Chau Shik-hong’s oil paintings use the iconic Hong Kong bamboo flower plaque, embodied in the social contexts before 1997 and painted in many landmark buildings around the city, thereby shaping the cultural landscape of the post-1997 carnival city. Wong Shun-kit’s ink creations capture history, images, social events, people, legends, fables, imagination and city life to create a ritual of cultural contexts and the dramatic manifestation of social evolution.

This exhibition displays the recent works of these two Hong Kong artists, who reflect the concerns of their generation. Their starting points of art thinking and the artistic languages of their personal styles also reveal the post-1997 new creativity and the new look of Hong Kong art.
column38:
文化在當代不僅僅是傳承傳統的習性，而越來越傾向人們自覺選擇生活價值觀及實現這個價值觀所形成的生活方式。文化景觀是居住在特定地域的社群成員，為滿足其自身社會發展需要而建立的日常生活場景，並寄寓這群人們的理想和精神家園。是人、事、物在一定時空中，交錯疊置的歷史生命體。後九七香港特殊的歷史階段，見證了一國二制新的體制下社會轉型，經歷本地文化語境的變幻。

長期以來香港藝術界沉浸在超凡脫俗的新水墨現代藝術語境內，九七後新一代藝術家將藝術融入社會生活，香港藝術伴隨著社會進程的脈搏，產生了新的生命力。藝術家王純傑、巢錫雄是這藝術思潮的中堅成員，他們運用藝術圖像，從不同視角、不同解讀方式，演釋一個現代都市從社會轉型走向文化迷津的歷史片段。

巢錫雄油畫具運用標誌性的香港本地節慶花牌，嵌入香港九七前社會話語，繪在香港城市各地標建築物中，塑造嘉年華式的後九七城市文化景觀。在當下重閱這些話語，反思社會轉型過程中現實與初衷之間的關係。王純傑的大幅水墨創作將歷史、圖像、社會事件、人物、傳說、寓言、想像、城市生活等創造一個個儀式化的文化情境，戲劇性的表現社會演化。

這個畫展是兩位香港思考一代的藝術家新近作品展現，他們對藝術思考切入點和個人藝術語言風格，也表現了後九七時期香港藝術新的創造力和新面貌。

column37:
Content： From September 2013 to August 2015, Gum has mailed one letter to the Chief Executive Office, for Mr. Leung Chun Ying, every week, along with selected news-clips and Gum’s opinion about the news article. Gum, then, receives a letter from the secretary of the Chief Executive and related government departments every week. The current exhibition will showcase the process of communication with Mr. Leung Chun Ying in mail throughout the project. 

Exhibit： 
-About one hundred replied letters will be exhibited, along with all the related information and materials, in order to show responses of the artist toward his concerned social issues
column38:
內容： 於2013年9月至2015年8月，每星期閱報後，找出一些有關政府施政、政策等的報道，然後把自己對相關報道的意見，連同該剪報，寄到行政長官辦公室，給梁振英收，然後每星期都收到行政長官私人秘書及相關政府部門的回信。而這展覽將展示自己與梁振英的書信往來的過程。 

展示： 
-100星期以來共有約一百封回信，將分門別類在展場中直接展示回信真品，並連同適當的相關信件的資料、內容，以展示藝術家對自己所關心的社會時事，會作甚麼回應。

column37:
Content: Every week from September 2013 to August 2015, Gum goes to one MTR subway station to discover nearby sculptures, architectures or empty space that are non-user friendly, too much old-fashioned or being completely abandoned. Using his “discovery” as background, Gum then takes one photo of one dance posture around each MTR station. All the photos of different dance postures will be combined to be a simple stop-motion animation. 

Exhibit： 
- Around 90 photos taken around different MTR stations, during the 100 weeks, will be printed out in A3 size and exhibited in order.
- Meanwhile, a 1-minute stop-motion animation will be projected, with the artist’s figure in a life size ratio in the venue. This series of works attempts to reveal problematic issues about public space, through the artist’s perspective, in a humorous and critical way.
column38:
內容： 於2013年9月至2015年8月，每星期到全港各港鐵站，發掘每個車站附近非人性化、老土、被視若無睹、被荒廢的建築 或 戶外公共雕塑 或 空地，並以此作為背景，拍攝藝術家一個跳舞動作，預計兩年後共有一百個跳舞動作，並可串連成一輯簡短的單格動畫 

展示： 
- 把100星期以來於約九十個港鐵站拍攝的照片，順序編排和打印成約90幅約A3照片展示 
- 另，把照片製作成一齣約一分鐘的單格動畫，透過影像投射，以1：1真人大小展示於展場中。以嘻笑怒罵方式展示藝術家心目中，值得注意的公共空間。

column9: Open Space, Cattle Depot Artist Village, Kowloon
column10: 馬頭角道地63號牛棚藝術村戶外空地
column37:
Content: Gum has received more than 100 promotional phone calls from September 2013 to August 2015, and has jotted down all these numbers. Most of these calls are about commercials or loans, and the phone numbers of these incoming calls seldom repeat. In the end of the two-year period, Gum will call back each phone number in record, with a monotone, (to resemble most incoming promotional phone calls), and invite the phone operators to the current exhibit opening.

Exhibit: All the phone numbers being recorded will be displayed, and the phone conversations with different phone operators will be played at the venue as well.
column38:
內容：於2013年9月至2015年8月期間，記錄曾致電阿金的電話宣傳電話號碼，共約超過一百通不同的來電宣傳，當中大多數是與推廣借貸有關，而聚多來電的號碼中，卻極少重覆。兩年過後，阿金將逐一就記錄低的宣傳來電號碼，進行回電，並邀請接線者出席參觀本展覽。阿金進行回電邀請時，將參照多數電話宣傳的呆板讀稿方式展開對話宣傳。 

展示：展示阿金逐一就記錄低的宣傳來電號碼，及播放進行回電的全部電話錄音

column9: 2 - 3/F, 99F Wellington Street, Central
column10: 中環威靈頓街99F號2-3樓
column37:
Content: 
Between September 2013 and August 2015, Gum does push-ups every night before bedtime (20 push-ups for the first day, and, with an increase everyday, more than 50 push-ups after one month, and then proceeding to 100 push-ups until now). This simple repetition of the same activities has been continued for two years in order to “sculpt” the artist’s body, which becomes the material for art making. During the time being, Gum also has taken one self-portrait each week. 

Exhibit: 
The artist photographer, Martin Cheung, who is very experienced in film stills, is invited to shoot a portrait series of Gum Cheng. This photo series echoes the atmosphere of the exhibition venue, a bar setting. About 10 photographs from this series will be selected and printed out in A2 format for the exhibition. 
Meanwhile, all the portraits taken during the 100 weeks will be combined together in order to produce a stop-motion animation. One can witness the changes and endurance of the artist within a minute, through the animation film played with monitor and projector at the exhibition venue.
column38:
內容： 於2013年9月至2015年8月，阿金每天臨睡覺前規定做一節掌上壓(首天，一節只做到二十多下，一個月後就做到五十多下，現在約一百下)，以純粹重複做單一種運動讓自己修身，並將持續兩年，達至「雕塑自己」，希望以自己身軀作為素材，逐天逐天為自己雕刻，然後，每星期為自己拍攝一次全身照。 

展示： 
-配合展場會所酒吧格局，邀請對拍攝電影劇照具豐富經驗的攝影藝術家張震揚，為阿金拍攝一輯塑身後的個人全身照。預計之後從中挑選約十幅，再分別放大至A2尺寸，並會展示於展場中。 
-把累積100星期的個人全身照，順序編排，並製作成一齣單格動畫，以不到一分鐘的快速，展示及見證兩年以來的耐力磨練。單格動畫將同時透過電視 / 投影，展示於展場中。

column9: Anita Chan Lai-ling Gallery, Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road, Central
column10: 中環下亞厘畢道2號香港藝穗會陳麗玲畫廊
column37:
Content: Between September 2013 and August 2015, Gum paints one self-portrait each week, based upon mass media’s representation of himself. During this painting project, he has done a large-scale study to search for his portraits appearing on newspaper, magazines, televisions, online-media etc, and then re-present his images from mass media on canvas. 
Hong Kong has been lack of systematic writings about local art history. Sorted files of artworks being represented in mass media can formulate an effective art archive. Because of his role as an artist, Gum’s image is being represented and documented in mass media. Instead of being all the way passive, Gum Cheng has adapted a more pro-active approach to re-appropriate the power of the media to further express his own artistic ideas. The current series of paintings make use of the reports of the artist in mass media. A simplified personal history is being re-packaged in the paintings to reveal the sustainable development of an alternative dimension of the artist’s life. 

Exhibit: 
-100 oil paintings on canvas in different sizes (from 20 X 30cm to 70 X 100cm) will be exhibited
column38:
內容： 於2013年9月至2015年8月，每星期為自己繪畫一幅自畫像，而自畫像的參考是原自一面社會鏡子：傳播媒體。大規模搜集自己被傳播媒體，包括報章雜誌、電視、網絡媒體等拍攝到的肖像，以繪畫藝術方式再呈現。 香港，一直也缺乏對本土藝術歷史的整理，所以藝術創作透過媒體記錄後便成為一項有效的文獻整理，藝術家相信自己的肖像因藝術相關工作，被動地被傳媒拍攝並紀錄存檔，於是藝術家希望採取主動，適當地利用「傳媒」如槓桿般的力量，以主動的方式把自己對藝術的理念向外散佈。本系列創作就是取材自媒體對關於自己藝術創作的報導，把一個簡單的自我形象，重新包裝，自畫自說，紀錄自我歷史的一刻，以另一個形態在世上延續地再呈現。 

展示： 
-100幅尺寸不一的繪畫作品，媒介主要為油畫布本，尺寸介乎20 x 30厘米至70 x 100厘米

column9: 100 ft. Park
column10: 百呎公園
column37:
Content: Gum has taken photos of his two daughters at the same site, with the same postures, once a week from September 2013 to August 2015, in order to document their changes in the two years. 

Exhibit: One photo from each week will be selected from the few hundreds of photographs, and then printed out in 4R size for the exhibition. Meanwhile, all the portraits taken during the 100 weeks will be combined together in order to produce a stop-motion animation. One can witness the growing process of the artist’s two daughters within a minute, through a life-size projection of the animation in the venue.

展示：

column37: This exhibition pays tribute to Mr. Zhang Dawo, a seventy-year-old artist living in China/Australia, for being the most enduring, the most representative and the most accomplished master in the search of contemporary calligraphic art and writing, in present China. Throughout his thirty years of practice, he makes important contributions in the conversion of ink writing from traditional to modern art. This exhibition presents the entire evolution of Dawo’s artistic pathway.

column19: Donation of Works by Wu Guanzhong 2014
column37:
Dedicating his whole life to art, Wu Guanzhong selflessly donated his works to museums in the country and worldwide. The generosity of Wu had moved many. Over the years, he had donated his works to the Hong Kong Museum of Art for four times. Having inherited Wu's selfless spirit, his family again made a donation of 25 paintings to the Museum, which now holds a total of 77 pieces of Wu's works.

The 25 works, including 16 oil paintings and 9 ink paintings, were created from the 1990s to the early 21th century, a period known as the heyday of Wu Guanzhong's artistic journey. The Museum has selected some of the works for exhibition so that the public can have a taste of these precious gifts.
column38:
吳冠中多年來先後共四度捐贈作品予香港藝術館，現在他的家人亦繼承了他無私奉獻的精神，於本年再次捐贈，加上這次所捐贈的25幅，香港藝術館十分榮幸地藏有他的捐贈作品合共77幅。

這25幅作品創作於20世紀90年代至21世紀初，被稱為吳冠中先生的「黃金時代」，當中包括16幅油畫及9幅水墨作品。藝術館特意選展部分捐贈作品，讓市民可以率先欣賞這份無價的藝術餽贈。
