column20: 「行雲。聽山」— 李志章山水畫展
column29: Hong Kong Visual Arts Centre Exhibition Hall
column37: In our busy modern world, how often do we stop and sense the beauty of nature and the tranquility that it provides? The Chinese ink paintings of Hong Kong artist Lee Chi-cheung imparts a sense of tranquility and harmony, projecting images of nature that convey a moment in time and revealing the emotion of the artist in the process of creation.
column38: 繁華的都市，人們總是掛了一身緊湊的節奏；日復一日的庸碌，何時才得以停下腳步，驚嘆廣浩的大自然?香港畫家李志章氣勢磅礡的大自然山水美景創作能帶動我們進入忘我「淨心」的境界。

column29: University Museum and Art Gallery, The University of Hong Kong
column37: Nature in its harmonious forms: Paintings by Tao Wan is a comprehensive selection of the artist’s creative output and artistic theories. The exhibition highlights objects from the recent acquisition of nearly three hundred works generously donated by Tao’s family, which include landscape paintings and seals
column38: 《澐山‧真意：陶澐書畫回顧》將展現一代香港畫壇大師陶澐（一九一一至二零零四）的作品及其藝術思想。陶氏後人慷慨捐贈三百多件作品予香港大學美術博物館作永久典藏，並於今次展覽中展出超過一百件包括山水畫和印章等展品。

column19: NEW LIGHT VII • The Shape of Time • Dorothy Wong
column37: "Breaking free from perspective, layers of images show frames within frames. Each picture steps from one space to another, flows from landscape to image, advances to moving image, pushes further into painting, and finally lands on the pure spatiality. The exhibition is not only about the practice of viewing layered images progressively, but also an exercise to re-evaluate how time moves in a video."
column38: 「畫面框中有框，框中有框，退掉透視法的羈絆，踩著一個空間到另一種空間，從景到影像；再到錄像、畫及純空間性。在攝影和錄像兩者之間，靜態攝影可以是律動的，而流動影像卻可以是靜止的。是次展覽是一個關於疊進的看的練習，也是關於重新思考錄像中時間流動方式的練習。」

column37: Para Site is proud to present Orchestrations, a solo exhibition by Samson Young that looks at the modalities of "orchestra-making” in the various communities of Hong Kong. The exhibition consists of a selection of existing works and new commissions. It is the culmination of a year-long musicological research into the history of orchestras by Young in conversation with curator Qinyi Lim and musicologist Dr. Giorgio Biancorosso.

column19: PHOTO MATTERS: BOOK AND PRINT FESTIVAL 2016
column20: 翻閱相像：攝影紙本藝術節2016
column29: Kaitak Centre for research and development in Visual Arts
column30: 啟德視覺藝術研究與發展中心
column37: Every year, Through Our Eyes (TOE) Photography Education Programme holds an exhibition – in different forms and styles – to showcase students’ work as the programme comes to its end. The works display this year in Photo Matters: Book and Print Festival 2016 are the result of students’ exploration and reconfiguration of books, magazines and other forms of paper. Imaginative and innovative, the students experimented with materials, sizes, printing, layout and even the way they turned the page. During the process, they were presented with the infinite possibilities of photo reading by playing with elements such as time, sequence, speed and pace. Using paper as the unchanging medium, they tried to embody different styles, different sentiments and different stories through the connecting images.
column38: 在「翻閱相像：攝影紙本藝術節 2016」，同學以書刊及紙本創作，把照片實實在在呈現在人們眼前，各自運用巧思，探索不同的材料、尺寸、印刷、版面配置和翻法，實驗不同時空、次序、速度和節奏下閱讀的無限可能，嘗試以相同的媒介，在接連的影像之間，展現不同的風格、不一樣的感覺，與更多故事。

column38: 《天水圍人》是一個自發的社區行動，旨在發掘埋藏於周遭的故事。兩名80後，眼見天水圍日漸變得面目全非，一直希望為自己的成長地做些事。受 “Humans of New York” 啟發，《天水圍人》在社區漫步，隨意跟居民閒談，把他們的故事、夢想、感受一一紀錄下來。一張照片，一段文字，希望為天水圍人建立一種社區連結，亦盼望天水圍以外的香港人對這個社區有不一樣的瞭解。

column19: Raw Intent: ANTONY MICALLEF solo exhibition
column35: Antony Micallef was born in Swindon, England in 1975 and graduated in Fine Arts from the University of Plymouth. He was notably taught by the austere landscape painter John Virtue, who was taught by the postwar painter Frank Auerbach. Described as a modern Expressionist and widely recognized as one of the finest painters in contemporary art today, Micallef roots his work in social commentary and self-examination. His latest series, Self, consists of introspective self-portraits that also explore the artist’s relationship with paint.

column37: Sea of Faces is a unique and challenging project, featuring portrait drawings by Hong Kong artist Chloe Ho. With her remarkable insight and attention to nuance, Chloe chronicles the human state through figure drawings and paintings, reflecting her continued investigation into the issue of self and identity. Located between representation and self-reflection, Chloe’s collection of ‘New Portraiture’ seeks the answer to the fundamental question of how the ‘self’ has been constructed and interpreted throughout mankind’s collective history.

column37: Puerta Roja celebrates Hong Kong Art Week and the 1-year anniversary of SoHo 189 Art Lane, with the opening of Anamnesis: the reasoned doubt with works by María García Ibañez and Javier León Pérez. Curated by Pilar Cano Romero, the exhibition will present a brand new series of works stemming from a collaboration between the two young Spanish artists that have captured the imagination of collectors across Asia Pacific. The works will also be shown in a curated booth during Art Central. Both artists will be present at the opening and throughout the duration of the art fair.

column19: Shadow -- Joint Exhibition of Chan Yii Rong, Choi Ho Ming & Li Zi Rui
column20: 《影》— 陳乙榕、蔡浩銘及李志蕊聯展
column35: Chan Yii Rong, Choi Ho Ming & Li Zi Rui
column37: Shadow seems to be a tacit part of our body which follows every tiny movement of us, yet, we seldom perceive it. "Shadow" can be interpreted in terms of its physicality, the psychological projection of our inner selves or the embodiment of multiple characters. Through capturing light and shadow, the three participating artists will inquire into the states of shadow, imagine and reflect the concept of "shadow" by hypothesizing the loss of it.
column38: 影子彷彿是身體的一部分，光照下它緊跟身體最細微的移動，然而我們很少感受它的存在。「影」可以指物理上的光影活動、人的心理投射，或多重性格的載體；三位參展人將捕光捉影，探問影子處於虛與實之間的狀態，並假設失去了影子，從而對「影」作出想像與思考。

column20: 莎茲亞‧西坎達：意象演義
column37: Shahzia Sikander (1969 - ) presents her first major solo exhibition in Hong Kong. This body of work explores Hong Kong’s colonial complexity, both historical and current. Installed within the Former Explosives Magazine Compound of Asia Society Hong Kong Center, Shahzia Sikander: Apparatus of Power includes drawings on paper and large-scale animations. The exhibition’s title refers to the potential of an image to communicate in multiple contexts, forms, and formats.
column38: 《莎茲亞‧西坎達：意象演義》是莎茲亞‧西坎達 (1969年－) 在香港的首個主要個展。前身為英軍軍火庫的亞洲協會香港中心內會展出多件紙本畫作和大型動畫，以探討香港今昔殖民狀況。展題意指西坎達的意象蘊含能於不同語境、形態和方式表意的

column9: 12 Berkeley Street, London W1J 8DT, U.K.
column37: The exhibition SOME SCREEN MODS features a series of new film paintings (all 2016) derived from movies dating back to 1919 - from comedies such as The Blacksmith to Fritz Lang’s Dr. Mabuse the Gambler. The extreme aspect ratios of the canvases are also based on mid-century wide screen formats such as Cinerama and Todd-AO. Each painting consists of abstract/semi-abstract, spectral, monochromatic forms, simultaneously re-engaging early 20th Century black and white cinema and the tradition of the Modernist monochrome. Recalling X-Rays, Rayographs and other technical images, this new work triggers the latent tendency toward pareidolia, the psychological condition of finding figurative images in abstract forms. It also asserts one possible recalibration of painting toward an emerging way of seeing. Viewers, in an act of seeing that mimics current facial recognition software, begin to assemble a complex web of spectral figures and formal relations.

column19: The Black & White Show Oil Painting Exh
column37:
“Over the nearly 40 years that I’ve been living in art, the colour scheme I’ve adopted has evolved from mixed colours to the recent pure white. I can’t explain what it is or why it is. One thing I know for sure is that my art life still goes on, and I will keep on painting. Instead of trying to change the world, I will just paint in a natural way and let the works speak for themselves. That’s what I have been sticking to. The colour white is enriched in time and time dissolves in white. How beautiful it is. I have been thinking about the concept of “extreme”.What do you think?” -- Wong Sauching

"I like black so arrogantly because it allows dreams to roam free. I can mix one tube of blue or red paint into a thousand tubes of black ones because the depth of black is just like a hole that allows thoughts to squeeze in and plainly expose themselves. It is blind and fears nothing. It presents to people what they are frightened of as well as what they love. So I will prepare myself for getting into trouble, and I am willing to set my mind at ease in the dark chaotic world before I get down to work on postmodernist art. I wish to practice the idea of the German philosopher Nietzsche that only through the beautiful and appealing veil of art, can humans endure the existing trauma. " -- Lin Yonglin
column38:
“如果這樣將近40年的藝術生活方式，從有彩色有黑有白，到最近的白色，是什麼？為什麼？一切都說不清，但是生活藝術會繼續活下去，畫下去。不去改變世界，順其自然去創作繪畫，讓作品有自己的說法，這也就是我的想法和做法。白色在時間中復化，時間也在白色中消失，白色，那是時間給的豐富白色，很美妙，我一直在思考“極致”，您覺得呢？” --王守清

“我極其自負地喜歡黑色，因爲它包含太多的夢想，我會往一千管黑顔料裏攙一管藍色或紅色顏料。因為黑色的深度，像個洞口，思想可以擠進去，變得昭然若揭。它什麼都不怕，它盲目，它使人們看到害怕的東西，看到喜愛的東西。因而我為自己將身陷麻煩做準備，願迷失在黑暗混亂的世界中慢慢緩解，然後再去作後現代的藝術。我希望能像德國哲學家尼采所講 ‘只有通過藝術那層美麗而誘人的面紗，人才能忍受‘存在的創傷’。”--林永霖

column19: The Sound of Nature– Solo Exhibition by Tetsu Takeda
column20: THE SOUND OF NATURE – 武田哲個展
column37:
Art Experience Gallery delightfully presents a solo exhibition by Japanese artist Tetsu Takeda, entitled “The Sound of Nature” - featuring his most recent paintings and sculpture works. It is his first exhibition in Hong Kong.

Lived in New York for more than twenty years and returned to Japan in 2010, shortly followed by the Fukushima nuclear disaster happened in the next year, the accident has made Tetsu rethink about life and our role as human beings interfering with nature. There has been a mist of despair and sorrow for many people in the country, in searching for hope and an exit to tranquility, nature has shown Tetsu a new pathway for his art.
column38: 曾旅居美國紐約多於二十年，於2010年回流日本，不久便發生了2011年福島核爆意外的事故，讓武田哲重新思考生命，以及作為人類如何和大自然共處的關係。有感國內及人們當中瀰漫著一片絶望和傷痛，在尋找希望和寧靜出口的同時，大自然給武田哲的創作指向了一條新的道路。

column19: The World under the Brush-Selected Paintings of Professor Jao Tsung-i
column20: 筆底造化 ─ 饒宗頤教授繪畫展
column29: Jao Tsung-I Petite Ecole, The University of Hong Kong
column30: 香港大學饒宗頤學術館
column37: Professor Jao Tsung-i believes that scholarship and art can be complementary and mutually beneficial. Therefore, when he researched on Chinese art history, including topics such as Dunhuang line drawing, and scholarship and philosophies of the masters of the late Ming Dynasty, he also studied the painting techniques of Dunhuang line drawing, as well as those of the masters of the Yuan and late Ming Dynasties. To deepen his understanding of these fields, he imitated paintings in Dunhuang sketch style, paintings of Huang Gongwang and Ni Zan of the Yuan Dynasty, as well as Zhang Ruitu, Wang Duo, Shitao, and Bada Shanren of the late Ming period.
column38: 饒宗頤教授認為學術與藝術兩者是應該互益互補，故他在研究藝術史，如敦煌白畫、晚明諸家的學術與思想等方面時，亦同時研究敦煌白畫的技法，以及元代與晚明諸家的畫法。為了加深對這些方面的瞭解，他亦臨仿敦煌白畫及元、明兩代諸家的畫作，尤於敦煌白畫、元代黃公望、倪雲林及明遺民張瑞圖、王覺斯、石濤、八大等人的繪畫，臨繪最多。

column10: 元創方S214室
column37:
Like a combination of fragmented tableaus, “Waiting for the Polar Express” features a collection of experimental works by Hong Kong young artist HUI Sze-lok Serene, examining the mentality between residing in distant places. In the exhibition, precisely thought-out conceptual and minimalistic works are arranged with the intention to create a spatial absurdity and delusion.

In this particular setting, the analogue of a window is extensively used, where a window frame conveys a strong representation of a ‘room’, exemplifying the idea of two separated spaces. She utilized numerous mirrors and images that represent the past encounters during her life in the Nordic countries. The conflict between a reflection of the reality and images captured from a distant world creates a virtual space within the room, and the distortion represents a state of unconsciousness and recurring mode of being distracted by memories from the present.

column37: In this exhibition, the two artists continue in their minimalist approach, employing white and the constrained use of other colors to reserved, temperate effect. The minimal appearance of these images draw the viewer’s focus toward the spiritual expression of the artworks, while their refined form evokes profound visual imagination regarding “themes of identity and nostalgia, blankness and memory” (Cui Cancan).

column37: This exhibition is comprised of a series of artworks that manage to break away from the rigid formalisms of modernism and demonstrate Chabet’s insistence on a more inclusive approach to art, a key aspect to the importance of Chabet’s practice in the Philippines and Southeast Asia. This is suggested in To Be Continued, wherein Chabet’s signature material: utilitarian and provisional plywood boards function simultaneously as object and surface. To Be Continued is completed in collaboration with Chabet’s former students, whom Chabet tasked to paint 10 panels of plywood by using and mixing red, blue and yellow paint (the emblematic colors of modernism). Their collective effort was exhibited in The Cultural Center of the Philippines in 2012 after being shown at Osage gallery in 2011.

column37: Tang Contemporary Art is thrilled to present Xie Nanxing’s solo exhibition “Someone’s Portrait” at its Hong Kong gallery, curated by Cui Cancan. The exhibition features seven works from the artist, including three works on paper and four oil paintings from his Someone’s Portrait series. The exhibition focuses on Xie Nanxing’s portraits for the first time in the form of case studies, exploring the methods of his artistic practice, the source of his understanding and creation to demonstrate his concept of the ‘portrait’ and how they come to form through personal choice and reflection.
column38: 「真實·亦或幻象」展出七位重要中國當代藝術家的精選作品。是次展覽探索藝術家們如何在過去十年的當代藝術實踐中影響了當代中國藝術史的發展，並建立 21 世紀中國當代藝術獨特的新藝術語言。

column37: This year, introducing the “Monkey”, Huang utilises a rich and profound artistic culture, revealing a distinctive personal style as well as a sense of modern aestheticism. The inspiration behind the sculpture stems from the famous moral of the “Three Wise Monkeys”.  However, the artist reinterprets the proverb—“Look not at what is contrary to propriety; listen not to what is contrary to propriety; speak not what is contrary to propriety”—in a humorous manner, depicting three courageous monkeys exaggerating the actions of “looking, listening and speaking”. Huang’s “Monkey” not only represents wit and intelligence, but also conveys the artist’s views towards the open-mindedness and diversity of this new era.

column19: Reverie - Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) Graduation Exhibition 2017
column37: The Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT) University in partnership with Hong Kong Art School (HKAS) announces that the Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) class of 2016 will open their graduation exhibition with a reception on the evening of 23 January 2016, marking the 18th year of the programme.The exhibition will take place at the Hong Kong Arts Centre, recognised as a Local arts incubator, in Wan Chai and held in the prestigious Pao Galleries, a gallery space known for housing world-class art events. It will showcase 48 graduating artists' work, which is the culmination of over a year of research, planning and execution.

column37: The suite of works are a meditation on the passage of nature's cycle and the temporal flow of birth and regeneration. The images are at once generative and sensuous, macabre and degenerate, opulent and awe-inspiring, carrying within them the vitality of the living, and the vulnerability of decay. For philosopher Michel Foucault, "heterotopias" designates real or imagined spaces of escape/departure, transformation, or revelation.

column10: 實現會社（香港上環皇后大道中222號 啟煌商業大廈 LG4/F 2室 ）
column37: The earliest land reclamation in Hong Kong Island can be traced back to mid-19th century. The rapid urban development has irrevocably changed the landscape and coastline of Hong Kong and it is still changing every day. New land was created; meanwhile harbour, islands and sea bays disappeared without any traces and often left unacknowledged. The dramatic transformation of land provokes Thickest Choi and he decides to draw up his own daring and devastating plan for the city. Over the course of the exhibition, Thickest Choi will draw his plan on the present map of Hong Kong. Audience is invited to participate to create the new land and develop the future of the city.
column38: 香港島最早期的填海造地可追溯至19世紀中。急速的市區發展令香港的地理面貌及海岸線面目全非，而不能逆轉的變化仍天天在發生。新土地出現的同時，無數的海港、島嶼和海灣消失得無影無蹤，也沒有人考究它們曾經確實的存在。急劇的土地變化激起了蔡志厚為香港起草毀滅性的城市規劃。展覽期間，蔡志厚會把土地計劃繪畫在香港現時的地圖上，觀眾亦會被邀請一起參與創造新土地和發展香港的未來。

column19: My Dear, You Shouldn't Believe in Fairytales
column35: Tejal Shah, Erkka Nissinen, Chen Zhou
column37: My Dear, You Shouldn’t Believe in Fairytales takes the construction of fairytales as a metaphor for the legitimization of narratives as a point of departure, and through a selection of works including Tejal Shah’s video installation at dOCUMENTA (13), Between the Waves; Erkka Nissinen’s 2011 Illy Prize winning Rigid Regime; and Chen Zhou’s new work, My Loving Artist - Yu Honglei, seeks to investigate the ideas of narrative, the body-subject and issues surrounding the enquiries into their (de)legitimization, (in)appropriateness and un/interchangeability.
column38: 「親愛的,那不是童話」以童話故事為比喻,作為探討敘事認可性 (合法性) 的起點, 並透過一系列的錄像和裝置作品,圍繞著非/認可性 (de/legitimization) 、非/相稱性 (in/appropriateness), 以及非/交替性 (un/interchangeability)的問題,試圖對敘事的意念、主題和爭議進行探索。這些作品包括德嘉‧沙 (Tejal Shah) 於第 13 屆卡塞爾文獻展展 出的映像裝置, Between the Waves ;艾克‧尼斯蘭 (Erkka Nissinen) 於 2011 年意利獎 (Illy Prize)的得獎作品, Rigid Regime ;以及陳軸的最新短片作品,《我喜歡的藝術家 – 尉洪磊》。

column36: 陳光武、張秀英、梁銓、Lin Guo Cheng、劉國夫、蘇勝前
column37: Mind and Scape: the mind and soul, the spirit and elements, the scene and landscape. The fusion of mind and landscape draws from tradition, harkening back to the ways in which Song, Yuan and Ming dynasty literati painting sought out possibilities beyond the approaches of Neo-Confucianism. As Dong Qichang famously said, “when it comes to the magnificence of the scene, the landscape (Shan-Shui or Moutain-water) surpasses the painting; when it comes to the ingenuity of brush and ink, the painting surpasses the landscape.” He was demonstrating the inevitability of the interplay between mental cultivation and the richness of the natural landscape.

column19: 《Lost and Found》－An Art Exhibition About Lost Objects By Ma Sin Mei & Chan Pak Kin
column20: 《物然回首》－關於失物的藝術展覽 馬蒨薇×陳百堅
column30: 香港浸會大學視覺藝術院
column35: Ma Sin Mei & Chan Pak Kin
column37:
Like every object had been used by people, lost items are contained marks of what people have gone through and "icons" of how people would have felt.

Ma Sin Mei and Chan Pak Kin, two local artists, have collected lots of lost objects. They examined each piece in details and re-interpreted the stories of the objects. Their dialogues vary, from daily life experience to historical events, from fantasy to real-life encountering. In the process, they reflected upon art and our material culture.

- See more at: http://ava.hkbu.edu.hk/2013/03/lost-and-found/#sthash.4X8TtBef.dpuf

column9: Pao Galleries, Hong Kong Arts Centre
column10: 香港藝術中心包氏畫廊
column37:
Painted in her unmistakable style, this series of vibrant, large-scale paintings is inspired by Ana Tzarev’s life long affinity for flowers.  Tzarev’s newest body of work, abundant with intense color and rich surface texture, demonstrates the artist’s unique ability to capture visual beauty and command powerful resonance in her imagery.
 
In these paintings, Ana Tzarev takes fundamental subject matter in the history of painting – flowers – and completely subverts it through the unexpected enormity of scale and the intense, physical presence of her surfaces.

column14: BU - Academy of Visual Arts Gallery
column19: PATH – The 3rd Christian Students’ Art Exhibition by HKBU Students & Alumni
column20: 道路 – 第三屆基督徒學生藝術展覽
column37:
“Path” means our lives in Jesus. It is about different stories, thoughts and experiences before, when and after we met God.

“Jesus answered, ‘I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.’” (John 14:6) The Bible says people could find truth only through Jesus. We believe Lord is the creator and leader of our lives.

The exhibition presents different stories which cover three stages – “Lost”, “Be found”, and “Be Built”. Each artwork serves as the artist's testimonies of his/ her personal experiences in Christianity, and moreover as a blessing to all audiences, both Christians and non-Christians.
column38:
“道路”指我們在耶穌裡的生命。這是關於在遇見上帝前, 認識祂, 及相信祂以後的不同故事、思想和經歷。

「耶穌說 : 我就是道路、真理、生命；若不藉著我，沒有人能到父那裡去。(約翰福音14:6) 聖經說人必要經耶穌才能找著真理, 我們相信祂是我們生命道路的創造與引導。

是次展覽展示不同的故事, 覆蓋了三個階段—“失落”, “被尋回”, “被建立”, 每件作品都為藝術家的見證, 是他們個人基督教信仰的經歷。對於觀眾, 無論是否基督徒, 都是一個祝福。

column19: Evolutionary Graphics : Computer Artworks by Visual Arts Students
column37:
From simple geometrical forms to complex imageries, this exhibition presents the computer artworks from Visual Arts students.

The artworks in this exhibition are the first attempts for most of the students to use programming as the creative medium to experiment with computer graphics, rather than using off the shelf software packages available in the market. By specifying very simple rules and relations among a few primitive shapes, such as line, circle, or square, they manage to generate imageries that are totally unpredictable and beyond expectations. Repetition and variation are the key themes. The ideas of complexity are well demonstrated through the works. Come and view the students’ apprehension of the beauty of programming.
column38: （只提供英文版本）

column35: Vivian Poon, Shih Yung-chun, Hui Kim Ho, Alice Lau
column36: 潘蔚然,時永駿,許劍豪,劉珮瑤
column37: Artists are always sensitive to the particularity of the daily routine, their attempt to search for the hidden events – sometimes banality in others’ perspective – is to regard all the tiny tracks and to transform them through their way of interpretation. By colors, by texture, or by form, in each moment of creation, their way of existence is reflected by their sincerity toward the canvas also as much as the religious repetition that would bond the artists and audiences together through the hidden beauty of the daily life. The four artists with various backgrounds here will share their “usefulness” but extremely peaceful and reflexive thoughts in this exhibition...

column19: ALEXANDER CALDER: SCULPTURE, WORKS ON PAPER AND JEWELLERY
column20: 亞歷山大 • 考爾德: 雕塑 • 紙上作品 • 首飾
column37: Ben Brown Fine Arts is pleased to present the first in-depth examination of works by legendary American artist Alexander Calder ever mounted in Hong Kong. Featuring his renowned mobile and stabile sculptures alongside vibrant works on paper and fanciful jewellery pieces, the show will provide an insight into the ingenious and highly innovative working methods of Calder throughout the 20th Century.

column37: The characters in They are the ordinary people in real life - they carry out all kinds of mundane activities in public venues. In Zhang’s images, these ordinary people become the protagonists in the scenes they occupy, often seemingly departing from reality and entering a performance state. These images perhaps reveal some loss of balance and normality caused by the rapid development of modern Chinese society.

column38: 當Digital Fabrication被《經濟學人》(The Economist) 形容為新一波工業革命而衝激消費社會，新媒體藝術的創作早就掛起了這旗幟，並在達達主義時期已經開始發酵進行。結合了跨媒體，藝術家和創作人以Digital Fabrication進行各種前衛及實驗的藝術創作，把新媒體創作的「能量轉換」特性化成現實，在不同媒體之間交互轉化，將聲音轉換成畫面，將畫面轉換成聲音。而Digital Fabrication的愈趨在地，創造的權利再一次大量回歸到創作者手上，並精準的化成實體呼應數位生活。

column19: Dance with the Interval | Tamas Waliczky's Exhibiton
column20: Tamas Waliczky 展覽「舞．動瞬間」
column30: 香港歌德學院歌德藝廊
column37: "Dance with the Interval" is Tamas Waliczky's first solo exhibition in Hong Kong. The exhibition will be the world premiere of Waliczky's two new installations: Wheels (2013) and Homes (2012).  Next to these installations visitors can watch a retrospective with the artist's earlier works, from 1986 till 2007.  http://www.hkvisualartsyearbook.org/chi/exhibitions_details.php?post_id=16651
column38: Tamas Waliczky的作品得獎無數，更是世界各地媒體藝術節的常客，能得到國際級的肯定，全因Waliczky的前衛的電腦影像創作同時著重形式及意念。這位國際級大師於香港首度舉行個人展覽，將展示其一九八六年至二零一三年間、十七個系列共三十部的電腦影像及互動媒體藝術創作，當中《Wheels》 (2013)及《Homes》 (2012) 更是首度曝光的全新作品。

column20: 香港藝術學院畢業創作展2013：應用藝術高級文憑──「城。癮」
column35: Graduates of Higher Diploma in Applied Art programme (Class of 2013)
column36: 應用藝術高級文憑課程畢業生(2013年度)
column37: 9 graduates from the Higher Diploma in Applied Art programme participated in this graduation showcase titled “Cit:diction”. Through the artworks created in different mediums, they expressed their ideas on the addictive behaviors of us who are living a hectic city life through every day observations.
column38: 九位修畢本課程的同學，透過對都市人的日常觀察，藉著年前的展覽及資料搜集，以今次創作展來總結成果，透過九組作品探討都市人的成「癮」現象，包括網絡成癮、購物成癮及賺錢成癮。同學透過作品展現城市人對金錢的慾望，追溯城市人七宗罪的根源，讓參觀者透過作品從新的角度了解自己及所生活的城市。

column37: There were 38 graduates participating in this graduation showcase held at different studios located in our Shek Kip Mei Campus. The works covered a wide range of medium including painting, photography, ceramics, sculpture and crossed-media installation, providing the audiences with a wide spectrum in contemporary art.
column38: 三十八位同學總結過往的學習經驗，透過繪畫、雕塑、攝影、陶瓷等媒介，表達個人感受和對社會的關注。同學的創作題材各異：有以畫布記錄對「家」的感覺；有同學透過繪畫留住變化萬千的堅尼地城；或以油彩表達女性的痛苦；又或以陶泥喚醒觀眾對小動物的關注。個別同學則專注物料的探索，例如以布料進行軟雕塑創作等。

column20: 「漸」──應用及媒體藝術文學士二零一三學生作品年展
column29: Hong Kong Art School, School of Professional Education and Executive Development, Hong Kong Polytechnic University
column30: 香港藝術學院、香港理工大學專業進修學院
column35: Graduates of Bachelor of Arts in Applied and Media Arts programme (Class of 2013)
column36: 應用及媒體藝術文學士課程畢業生(2013年度)
column37:
CRESCENDO, with the meaning of a gradual increase, especially in the volume and intensity of sound in a passage, bears a resemblance to each of the little steps the students have taken to form and become who they are now.  This exhibition was the celebration of the graduates’ achievement and success on their process of learning, developing and expressing their creative and unique ideas.

With a series of artworks which resembled the graduates’ crescendo of creative ideas, this exhibition featured the works of 28 graduates with themes ranging from self reflection to different social issues. The creative works were illustrated in diverse media including graphic design, game design, product and brand image design and animation.
column38:
「漸」，有著「數量漸進」、「聲音漸強」的意思，尤其指聲音的強度逐漸增加，就好像學生的學習過程，一點一滴地累積知識，不斷成長進步。回顧過去的學習生涯，畢業生不但在作品設計、構思和演繹手法的掌握和信心方面均有所提升，在創意之路上亦逐漸邁向成熟。而在老師的悉心引導與支持，以及朋輩間的互相鼓勵下，畢業生更能自信地透過作品，表達獨特的設計意念。


是次年展共展出28位畢業生的作品，題材豐富，內容涉獵自我反思以至社會議題等。畢業生應用表達媒介亦各有不同，其中包括平面設計、遊戲設計、產品與品牌形象設計和以及動畫設計等。

column19: Alpha to Infinity—Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) Graduation Exhibition 2013
column20: 「甲乙丙丁」──藝術文學士畢業展2013
column29: Hong Kong Art School, The Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology University
column30: 香港藝術學院、澳洲皇家墨爾本理工大學
column35: Graduates of Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art)programme (Class of 2013)
column36: 藝術文學士課程畢業生(2013年度)
column37:
Acknowledged as one of the most prestigious and sophisticated exhibitions at the bachelor degree level in Hong Kong, the Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) Graduation Exhibition 2013, jointly presented by the Hong Kong Art School and the RMIT University, took place at the Pao Galleries and Experimental Gallery of the Hong Kong Arts Centre this year from July 6 to 28. The exhibition showcased artworks in a diverse range of mediums, created by 50 graduates majoring in Painting, Ceramics, Photography and Sculpture.

“Alpha to Infinity” is the title of the Graduation Exhibition this year. Alpha is the first letter of the Greek alphabet. It also bears the numerical value of 1. In English, the noun “Alpha” is used as a synonym for “Beginning”. The graduates represented in “Alpha to Infinity”, have therefore taken plants as a metaphor for the exhibition to signify the creative development that has taken place during their time in the BAFA programme.
column38:
由澳洲皇家墨爾本理工大學與香港藝術學院合辦的「二零一三藝術文學士畢業展」，於今年七月六日至七月廿八日於香港藝術中心實驗畫廊及包氏畫廊展出。該展覽是學院一年一度的盛事，也是每年本地藝術學士課程備受注目的畢業展；今年展出五十位應屆畢業生以陶藝、繪畫、攝影及雕塑的等不同媒介創作的作品，給觀眾帶來不同的觀賞體驗及更多視覺衝擊。

「甲乙丙丁」乃古人記錄植物生長過程的其中幾個狀態：「破土萌芽，草木初生，萬物炳然，成長壯實」。修畢藝術文學士課程是成長過程的一個階段，辦一個展覽正好將畢業生在這階段的狀態展示。學院如土壤，種子播於其中，藝術家的人生歷程和經驗就是陽光和水，然後這顆種子萌芽、轉化、成長。最後無論是開花、或結果、或凋謝，都是循環中的一些狀態而已。

column19: Distilling Senses: A Journey through Art and Technology in Asian Contemporary Art
column20: Distilling Senses: A Journey through Art and Technology in Asian Contemporary Art
column33: Cissy Pao Pui Lai, Connie Lam
column35: Chang Yung Ta, Shilpa Gupta, Takashi Ishida, Lee Yongbaek, Nam June Paik, teamLab, Wang Ningde, Wong Chung Yu, Samson Young
column36: 張永達、夏爾芭．古普塔、石田尚志、李庸白、白南準、團體實驗室、王寧德、黃琮瑜、楊嘉輝
column37:
From the printing press to the portable camcorder, artists have always harnessed new technologies to create works that stimulate the senses, inspire the minds. 

In recent years, much new technology are being created and consumed in Asia. How does this environment affect artists from the region? 

Distilling Senses: A Journey through Art and Technology in Asian Contemporary Art, the Hong Kong Arts Centre's 5th Annual Flagship Exhibition, seeks to address this question by bringing together nine Asian artists. The exhibition explores how technology shapes art and how artists use technology to sharpen our senses and enhance understanding of our surroundings.

A free audio guide and school tours for senior secondary school students by the HKAC's “Art Available to All” education programme are also available.
column38:
從印刷技術到手提攝錄機，藝術家一直在利用新科技，創作出刺激感官、啟發思考的新作品。

過去幾十年，亞洲逐漸成為創造及消費大量新科技產品的地方，這種大環境對區內藝術家又有著甚麼樣的影響？

香港藝術中心第五屆年度旗艦展覽「Distilling Senses: A Journey through Art and Technology in Asian Contemporary Art」，正是要借九位亞洲藝術家的作品以探究竟。這次展覽旨在探索科技如何啟發藝術，以及藝術家如何運用科技來創作，幫助我們理解所處環境。

為豐富是次展覽，本中心安排了免費語音導賞服務，以及為本地高中生提供導賞的藝術導賞計劃「Art Available to All」。

column37: Central to all of Tim Ellis’ art is the idea that “a being has a primeval desire to want to belong to something greater than oneself.” This desire to belong manifests itself in both production and consumption of cultural artifacts. By researching, collecting and juxtaposing culturally diverse objects from once active societies, and by subtly reconfiguring their forms or abstracting from pre-existing designs, Ellis have built a collection of artifacts that appear as ready-made totems we have erected for ourselves.

column19: It May Be That Beauty Has Strengthened Our Resolve
column35: Philippe Grandrieux Lü Yue Masao Adachi Patrizio di Massimo Mladen Stilinović
column37: Para Site proudly presents It May Be That Beauty Has Strengthened Our Resolve, a group exhibition featuring works by Philippe Grandrieux, Lü Yue, Masao Adachi, Patrizio di Massimo and Mladen Stilinović. It brings together art pieces, films and biographies in which the artists' individual gestures, positions, statements, counter-manifestos, silences and escapisms share a certain tension about art's uncertain intersection with the present.

column19: The Angels in Me Solo exhibition of NG Kwun-lun Tony
column20: 《我的天使們》吳觀麟個人作品展
column37: One is supposed to be born with free will. However, our decisions in life are also influenced by external factors - time, place, our family, friends, work, the people we know and the ten thousand things. As I come through and reflect on my own life and formative influences, I see fragments of childhood memory and school days, surviving in the society, also trying to find my way in life and in art. At certain points, there were both my passionate involvement and indifferent observation; there were people and matters I thought I had forgotten, but they linger in my heart as new; others I tried my best to hold on to yet they slowly slipped away. I have come to realize that all of them formed my perception of life and the world, in contemplation of rightness, truth and beauty. My decisions in life, the exercise of my free will, are shaped by and inseparable from these influences. "Free will", after all, may not be purely "free".
column38: 人們生來本是擁有自由意志的。然而，當我回想自己的成長中的種種：兒時的回憶片段、學校裏的生活、到在社會裏謀事，和尋找自己藝術路向的日子之中，有些事情曾戲劇性地參與其中，或曾冷眼旁觀地置身事外；有些人和事，以為忘記了的，原來歷久如新；有費盡心思地記掛的，卻慢慢失去，它們原來卻一直影響著自己對世界和人生的看法，令我思索著生命中的善惡、對錯、真偽，箇中影響了抉擇和取捨。所以，我覺得後天的個人經歷，身處時空和環境變遷，往往會影響個人最終的行為和決定。自由意志似乎往往不盡然「自由」。

column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column19: Hong Kong Art School Alumni Exhibition of—The Inner Power
column20: 香港藝術學院校友作品 2013──The Inner Power
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37:
Why making art and what is more besides making? 

May the answers be freeing one’s ideas, defining one’s identity, celebrating some happy moments, exploring social issues, communicating with audience or as simply as pursuing aesthetics. 

Through the exhibition “The Inner Power”, the alumni of the Hong Kong Art School shared with the public their views on art making, providing the art lovers with an exquisite chance to view their artworks.
column38:
為什麼要創作藝術？

答案可能是釋放一個人的想法、確定一個人的身份、慶祝一些快樂的時光、探索社會問題、與觀眾溝通，或只是簡單地追求美學。透過展覽，香港藝術學院校友與觀眾分享他們對藝術創作的看法，同時讓一眾藝術愛好者有機會一睹他們的創作風格。

column9: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School (10/F of Hong Kong Arts Centre)
column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊 （香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column35: Doris Ling, Vanessa Wong, Katie Yeung
column37: The sensibility and emotion of mankind is always acknowledging our perception of reality. In this process, desire is often transformed into imagination which is also projected onto reality, conceiving delusion. The three graduates of the Hong Kong Art School’s BAFA programme invariably expressed and reflected on the complex and subtle relationship between the real and the phantom via a variety of medias (water color, oil and digital photography), witnessing the exquisite and intimate connections between people and emotion.
column38: 人類的觸覺及情感無時無刻在擴闊個體對現實的認知。在這過程中，人類的慾望往往會將想像投射到現實中，幻象由此萌生。 香港藝術學院三位應屆藝術文學士課程畢業生借助多種媒介(水彩、油畫和數碼影像)，不約而同反思真實與幻象之間複雜而精細的關係，見證著人與人之間微妙的聯繫。

column9: BLINK Gallery, 1-2/F, 480 Nathan Road, Yau Ma Tei, Kowloon, Hong Kong
column10: 九龍油麻地彌敦道480號一及二樓新華理大設計學院BLINK Gallery

column9: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School (10/F of Hong Kong Arts Centre)
column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊 （香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art
column37: What is your first impression towards a circus? Is it a place full of laughter and excitement? Through deconstructing, reorganizing and reconstructing the city architecture, a graduate of the Hong Kong Art School’s BAFA programme majored in painting, created a circus like city space with different performers in his solo exhibition, revealing to the audiences a forgotten city in which memories are like debris waiting to be reconstructed.
column38: 馬戲團給你的第一個印象是什麼？是一個充滿笑聲及刺激的場地？透過拆解、重組、再建構城市的建築物，香港藝術學院藝術文學士主修繪畫的畢業生，於個人展覽創造出一個如馬戲團的城市空間，再配合幻化不同的表演者，向觀眾透現了一個被遺忘的城市，像碎片般等待重組記憶。

column9: BLINK Gallery, 2/F, 480 Nathan Road, Yau Ma Tei, Kowloon, Hong Kong
column10: 九龍油麻地彌敦道480號二樓新華理大設計學院BLINK Gallery
column20: 全港T-shirt圖案創作比賽 [少年組展覽]

column9: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School (10/F of Hong Kong Arts Centre)
column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37:
The connection between parents and kids is always unexplainable. It is neither something theoretical nor genetic. It is like, when you grow up, you will gradually pick up those attitudes or characteristics from your parents which you hated most when you were a kid.

Stella Tsoi, a graduate of the Hong Kong Art School’s Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme majored in Photography, used the narrative nature of photographic images and words to tell the story of her parents, and to depict the invisible connection between them.
column38:
父母子女的血親牽絆是很微妙的，從小到大你最討厭他們的某些性格特質，長大後偏偏發現自己如搬字過紙般的全盤承繼過來。

香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程畢業生蔡心怡(主修攝影)，利用影像結合文字，闡述父母年輕時的故事，描繪與他們之間那無色，無形，無感的關連。

column9: BLINK Gallery, 1-2/F, 480 Nathan Road, Yau Ma Tei, Kowloon, Hong Kong
column10: 九龍油麻地彌敦道480號一及二樓新華理大設計學院BLINK Gallery
column19: Danni Ng First Solo Exhibition - Finding Floriography
column20: 吳丹妮首次個人作品展「尋找花語」

column9: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School (10/F of Hong Kong Arts Centre)
column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column35: Chan Ngai Kong Chris, Chan Pui Leng Peggy, Leung Sai Poon Kenny
column37: “1/3” in mathematics is the combination of two rational numbers but is eventually an infinite decimal. Such an endless feature, more or less, is equivalent to the ecological cycle of nature. However, the life of a city relates only to “death”, which could only be associated with through “memory” and “forgetting” while looking at our current city life. Through the exhibition, three graduates of the Hong Kong Art School’s Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme showed such changes of city view through their different and unique perspectives.
column38: 「三分一」在數理上是「有理數」的組合，是永遠除不盡的無窮小數，好比自然環境的生生不息，生態的循環。城市裡的「風景」往往只能與「逝去」拉上，繼而牽著「懷念」與 「再生」。透過展覽，3位香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程畢業生分別展出因城市生活風貌的變遷，所引發其對現代化環境那種「逝去」又「再生」的獨特詮釋。

column9: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School (10/F of Hong Kong Arts Centre)
column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column35: Ho Lok Chung, Tuen Chun Tai Ivy
column37: Through the exhibition titled “Some_’s Affair”, two graduates of the Hong Kong Art School’s Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme would like to search the materials for their art creation in a way of unpredictable encounters. The two artists stationed at the venue (during the period of 1/11-7/11) so as to make use of the people, incidents and objects that they encountered as the “ingredients” for their instant art creation. Even though the artists did not know what they would encounter, for sure they knew that the emergence of the audience would be a part of their artworks. The exhibition venue was like a private room, the artists were waiting for the audience ---a mysterious encounter.
column38: 2位香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程畢業生於名為《外遇》的展覽，以外遇的形式尋找他們創作中的物料。這次，兩位藝術家會通過長時間駐守在展場 (1/11-7/11期間)，在展場中，把他們相遇的人、事、物成為創作的「材料」，直接地在展覽中進行創作。在這種外遇經驗之前, 他或她也不知將會遇見甚麼，肯定的是，觀眾的出現會是這展覽作品的一部份。展場就像一個私密的房間，等待觀眾的出現，一個神秘的相遇。

column20: 伙炭藝術工作室開放計劃2014
column37:
Fotanian Open Studio event brings together a
vibrant community of artists and art lovers who
transformed industrial lofts into art studios. With
the migration of industries to the Mainland, our
local creative have started to take refuge in the
spacious lofts of vacant industrial buildings
since 2000. Fotanian Open Studio Programme
is a major annual event in the local art
column38:
「伙炭」意謂一群在火炭工廠大廈內聚集,對藝術
充滿熱誠的一伙人。 隨著本港工業北移,自2000年
開始,不少本地藝術家紛紛在工廠大廈設立工作
室。「伙炭藝術工作室開放計劃」是每年一度的本
地藝術界盛事。開放日於每年1月份連續幾個週末
於火炭工業區舉行。屆時藝術家將開放他們的工作
室,讓公眾人士按圖索驥 ,遊訪他們的創作天地。

column37: Tang Ying Chi, a visual artist is inviting you to take a picture with this anonymous person. The unknown person is one of the many figures painted from Tang's self-taken photographs in the streets of Hong Kong. The work is painted directly from digital projection on canvas and is further printed for display site-specifically. Here, Tang is introducing this stranger to you and encouraging you to find more about the person in the context of city development.
column38: 視覺藝術家鄧凝姿邀請你跟這位無名氏合拍一張照片。，這位不知名人物是鄧氏眾多從香港街道上自行抓拍所得、再繪畫的行人圖像之一。作品是在數碼投射的帆布上直接繪畫、然後打印，在特定現場中展示，鄧氏在這裡向你介紹這位陌生人、並鼓勵你從城市發展的脈絡中對他認識多一點。

column14: BU - Koo Ming Kown Exhibition Gallery
column37:
Coming to the 8th year of The Academy of Visual Arts (AVA) in HKBU, we are glad to see how graduates had evolved and proceeded in the art field. Regarding their success, we could not help wondering what actually are the differences between the undergraduates and the alumni of AVA.

“L I N K A G E”, the title of the exhibition, does not simply mean the connection between art pieces and themes, but also is among the artists themselves. The uniqueness of these two parties links and collides in this exhibition will be unprecedented.

- See more at: http://ava.hkbu.edu.hk/2013/03/%e2%80%9cl-i-n-k-a-g-e%e2%80%9d-student-x-alumni-exhibition/#sthash.C04iQfLG.dpuf

column30: Academy of Visual Arts, Hong Kong Baptist University
column37:
In recent years, glass-blowing has inched its way towards becoming one of the most dazzling mediums of art. This exhibit features works from numerous artists, as well as Baptist University Academy of Visual Arts students.

There’ll also be a ceremony demystifying this bold form of creativity—Also, don’t miss the glass-blowing workshop, for a rare taste of art in action!
column38: 玻璃藝術，奇妙幻化於 0 – 1200℃，近年來逐漸成為當代藝術創作的亮眼媒材之一。是次展覽將展出來自多位本地玻璃藝術家及浸會大學視覺藝術院學生的作品，題材豐富色彩繽紛，天馬行空創意無限。開幕禮當日另設有講座，深入淺出介紹玻璃藝術的幻妙面紗。更舉辦玻璃工作坊讓參加者一嘗吹玻璃的樂趣，機會難逢!

column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37:
once you name it, it dies
a circle... a cycle...

Hung Po Po, student of the Hong Kong Art School's Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme, would like to express her views on thinking through her paintings in the upcoming exhibition.
column38:
名想，意思是為那段思考的時間起名，當努力回想剛剛在想甚麼的時候，其實剛剛的那段時間便已悄悄溜走，己成過去，回頭的只是一種想念。
無意溜走；忽然想起；設法投入；不行；起了名字；已死；又是一個圓。 香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程學生─ 洪寶寶，於展覽透過一幅幅畫作，分享她對思考的看法。

column9: New Asia College Ch'ien Mu Library, The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Sha Tin, New Territories
column10: 香港中文大學新亞書院錢穆圖書館

column9: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School (10/F of Hong Kong Arts Centre)
column10: 香港藝術學院藝廊（香港藝術中心十樓）
column29: The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School
column37: Under the rapid transformation of our society, local crafts and craftsmen gradually vanished from our sight. Ordinary crafts become extraordinary. Students of the Hong Kong Art School's Higher Diploma in Applied and Media Arts programme and students of the Lingnan University's Department of Cultural Studies have learned the techniques and steps of crafts making from local craftsmen. They would like to represent the value, the meaning and possibilities of local crafts through their artworks in the upcoming exhibition.
column38:
工藝本是尋常事，只是在時代的巨輪下，工藝和工匠似乎從我們的視線中消失。當「尋常」變得不尋常，我們就只得尋它。我們尋見工藝，嚐它，也嘗它，希望它常在。
香港藝術學院應用及媒體藝術高級文憑的同學及嶺南大學文化研究系同學從工匠身上認識了工藝的基本技巧和工序。他們希望透過自己的作品，於展覽再現工藝的價值、意義和可能性，作為對工藝的回應。

column35: Siumou Chow, Damon Tong, Tam Kar-Wing, Leo Wong
column36: 周小某、唐偉傑、譚家榮、黃振欽
column37: Four graduates from different majors of Hong Kong Art School’s Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme, have been working for the School’s gallery during different periods of time and helping students and alumni to organize and set up their exhibitions at the School Gallery. While in the exhibition 《Install/Uninstall》, they recalled their past experience and memories as gallery coordinators; from their expertise of “install” and “uninstall”, they transform this interesting and paradoxical idea into unique and site specific works.
column38: 四位香港藝術學院藝術文學士畢業生，各主修不同媒介，卻曾是「白管子」藝廊 (香港藝術學院藝廊於2012年之前的名稱)的工作人員，為學生及校友舉辦展覽。今次他們角色逆轉，以藝術家身分並由學院為他們辦展覽。展覽《安裝/卸載》他們由回憶當時運作「白管子」的經驗作為出發點， 以吊詭、實驗及概念性的方向探討他們最擅長的「安裝」和「卸載」，從而發展了今次以不同媒介創作的獨特作品。

column19: CINEMA 2.0 - New Playable Art--New Playable Art: Media Art Exhibition
column20: CINEMA 2.0 - New Playable Art--媒體藝術展
column37: Between the frivolity of play and the solemnity of fine art, New Playable Art explores the overlap of computer games and art.  Brooklyn-based game artist Tabor Robak enlarges the gaming experience of chaos of explosions and blood splatter, and collects the virtual world's sumptuous treasure stones in the reality, so as to reflect on game culture today.  Game researcher and designer Douglas Wilson inspires our reflection in another way by blending the joy of high-tech games and low-tech pastimes.  Try rock climbing on a full-body dance mat or playing around with a music-enabled motion game.
column38: 電腦遊戲陪伴很多人成長，但又有多少人在精彩刺激過後，會思考電腦遊戲的本質？來自紐約的藝術家Tabor Robak 把遊戲世界裡血肉橫飛大爆炸的經驗放大，把虛擬世界過關收集的寶石帶到現實，讓我們重新思索箇中的各種真真假假。遊戲設計師與研究者Douglas Wilson 則會帶你在跳舞墊上感受攀石，拿着控桿比武，穿梭來個兵捉賊，遊走於科技遊戲與原始趣味之間。

column20: 《老爹媽銀光匯坊》   之「小水點歷險記」展覽
column38: 應Hong Kong Alzhelmer’s Disease Association  香港認知障礙症協會的邀請，於2013年12月11-13日在香港會議展覽中心舉辦了一場小型展覽去配合第十六屆國際認知障礙症協會亞太區學術研討會 The 16th Asia Pacific Reginal Conference of Alzheimer’s Disease International.展覽中，我們一共展出了7幅長者們作品。主題是以一粒灑落人世間水點的故事作引言，以敘事互動式的藝術手法，邀請長者們描說及繪畫每一次小水點歷險過程中降落的地方來創作、從他／她們樸實的繪圖中我們不單能理解到他們不同的人生經歷及盼望，更可窺探屬於每一人的獨特生命。

column37: http://www.experimenta.hk/blog/the-personal-the-political-2/
column38:
上星期參觀了在Experimenta 舉行的一個名為
＂不滿[個人政治]＂的展覽，訪問了展品中短片的主角-數位自香港大埔龍女子欖球隊的成員及教練。訪問除了令我對㰖球這運動了解多了些之外，更重要是真
的給這球隊對㰖球的熱誠及團結感動了。她們除了日常上班外，放工就會去練波，甚至比賽受傷也阻不了她們的鬥志及團結，真是難得！
想像中，女子㰖球成員應該是比較粗豪，這証實是錯的，因為她們都很斯文及嬌小。
最後，回到藝術範疇，黃思源藉短片裝置諷刺現今社會政治，宗教及 自我形像都受到男性統治的情況。藝術家把展覽場地變成欖球場草地，配合片中女子㰖球
比賽的錄像，以不同的慢動作及倒後動作效果去表現。加上女子㰖球員在展覽的親身出席及親述,都令到這件作品變得更立體及有說服力！
同場亦有林愷倩 名為＂交友" 的展覽，她以不同性別的男女所登的徵友廣告，讓觀眾猜估登廣告的人及徵友對象的性別。最後觀眾更可即場貼出自己的徵友廣
告。這作品正好給觀眾機會反思自己先入為主的性別觀念與實際情況的差別。
總括來說，這展覽就如展覽的一個短述一樣，＂中環地段 , 細小後巷空間, 發起新暴動 ! 兩位女藝術家, 對現在的權力結構發聲!＂ 。這展覽中各展品互相呼
應，給觀眾對男女的性別地位一個獨特的看法及反思機會！

column20: 《身體能說的秘密》多媒體藝術展
column29: Anti-480 Anti-Sexual Violence Resource Centre and Committee Against Sexual
column30: Anti480反性暴力資源中心、香港城市大學防止性騷擾委員會
column37:
The one side of Relay is of words and drawings by a survivor, Man Sum (not her real name), while the other is my paper cutting which is a response of her story. 

As invited by Anti-480 Anti-Sexual Violence Resource Centre to join this exhibition, I have the opportunity to read the story of Man Sum. My heart was touched by the description of two drawings. When she started receiving counseling service, she drew a picture of a lonely dirty rabbit and the only company was its own shadow. The rabbit did not know where to go. Closing its eyes, it did not want to see anything. 
 
Later on, she has developed positive ways of solving her own problem. She talked to her father about her feelings. She even answered phone calls from her ex-boyfriend (the perpetrator) and told him that she was deeply hurt by him.
 
Man Sum drew another picture at the end of the services. This time the rabbit was clean and with no dirt and wounds to be seen. The rabbit was drawing a picture. In her picture Man Sum gave the rabbit two big eyes, so that it could draw. Her courageous has really touched me and her drawing has also reminded me of my work done previously called "RH: Raining", in which is a girl lowering her head, standing in the hand like rain motionlessly. She has nowhere to escape. I tried to remake this work. I want to have a big hand to hold these rain hands and feelings of helplessness no longer exist. 

My work tried to generate more discussion by listening and responding to the anonymous stories. According to the figures, in Hong Kong there are more than a thousand cases of sexual assault reported in a year. However, the figures do not reflect the reality. In fact, a lot of victims chose not to report their cases to the police. “Share indecent assaulted experience" was a hot topic on a popular Hong Kong forum (uwants.com) on the Internet. It shows that sexual assault is a serious and common crime in our city. However some victims only feel free to talk anonymously. I want to use my work to respond to these anonymous stories, hopefully the voice can be louder and be heard.
column38:
《接力》一邊是一位受助人文琛的繪畫和文字。另一邊是我回應的剪紙作品。

Anti480反性暴力資源中心聯絡我展覽，讓我有機會閱讀一位幸存者－文琛的故事 (文琛是筆名)。最觸動我的是她的兩幅畫：開始接受輔導時畫了一幅滿身污垢的兔子，她只有自己的影子陪伴她，也不知道自己要去那裡，並且緊閉雙眼，也不要看見甚麼。後來她用自己的方法去解開心結，向父親坦言自己的感受，接了前男友 (侵犯者)的電話，告訴他對她的傷害。之後她畫了一幅畫，白兔再沒有污垢和傷口了，並擁有一雙大眼請，站起來為自己畫畫。那自強的勇氣很觸動我。我的剪紙系列有一幅作品「雨」，一個女孩子低下頭站在手般的雨中動也不動，無處可逃。作品表達受害者的陰影，帶點無助。我也嘗試再做這幅作品，兩年後的我，想畫一雙大手捧著這些雨手，感覺不再無助了。

作品希望通過聆聽、肯定和回應去延伸討論。香港每年有千多宗的強姦非禮案，研究顯示，通常有多達八、九倍的受害人並沒有報案，「分享非禮經驗」更一度是網上討論區uwants.com的最熱門長期問題，可見問題的普遍性和嚴重性。有些女孩子在匿名的情況下才能暢所欲言。我想用作品去回應這些故事，使它們在另一渠道發聲，期望可以引起更多迴響。

The Pottery Workshop Gallery Hong Kong
G/F, 24 Upper Station Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 香港樂天陶社，香港上環差館上街24號地下
column20: 囹圄 Hikki Lau Solo Exhibition
column37:
Entrapped Innocence 
In the ruins of childhood memories, there is an innocent heart. This innocence endures through adulthood and is seasoned with experience and imaginations. It has no choice but to manifest itself in the world through creative process. With a pair of gifted hands, local artist Hikki Lau reconstructs with clay this once abandoned garden of innocence, reviving this psychological landscape and giving it a visual representation. The colorful nightmares and subdued sweetness in the artworks tell the story of a puzzled little girl who, surrounded by countless decisions of growing up, chooses to safeguard a morsel of pure land at heart.
column38:
身陷囹圄
在童年記憶的廢墟，埋著一顆純真的心。成長，令這顆心隨著歲月加載了各式各樣的現實和夢想。她別無選擇，只一直靜待時機，讓心的層次通過創作過程顯現出來。本地藝術家Hikki Lau用陶泥重構心中久經荒廢的花園、復修心內景觀，並把心境物化，成為藝術品。作品時而展示絢麗惡夢、時而流露褐色甜美，驟見背後躲著一個充滿疑惑的小孩，成長的洗禮每有磨滅真摯，但她決意維護一片小小的心靈淨土。

column9:
The Pottery Workshop Gallery Hong Kong
G/F, 24 Upper Station Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 香港樂天陶社，香港上環差館上街24號地下
column19: “B(read)” Solo exhibition of Ray, Chan See Kwong
column37: Chan gets inspiration from the bread making process and the related raw ingredients, produces a series of artworks using clay as the main medium to depict some of the old tales about bread or buns.  Through these artworks, Chan attempts to challenge our preconception of the use of clay in art making and to encourage us to have a deeper “reading” of the seemingly ordinary things around us.
column38: 今次展覽的創作靈感源自於麵包的製作過程，以及製作麵包的原材料。作者用陶泥、麵包原材料創作出一系列的陶藝作品，並結合麵包製作及陶器燒製的技巧，重新描繪出我們所熟悉的傳統麵包故事。同時，作者亦冀望此系列的作品可以衝擊思維，讓人跳出固有的思考模式，嘗試深度解讀，重新探索一些看似簡單、看似普通、看似熟悉的事物，其背後所蘊含的故事與意義。

column9:
The Pottery Workshop Gallery Hong Kong
G/F, 24 Upper Station Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 香港樂天陶社，香港上環差館上街24號地下
column19:
The Fragility of City Living
A solo exhibition by Ching Sze-Yin, Cicy
column20:
脆弱的城市生活
程詩賢 – 個人作品展覽
column37:
City is ever changing and ﬂooded with information. People living in a city often have very indiﬀerent and detached relationships with each other, because changes can happen so quickly and there are so many things competing for their attention.

This exhibition explores these relationships with a series of works using porcelain and metal. The chosen materials echo the concrete and steel that we use to build our city. Using long, cursive and delicate porcelain wires with linkages made by metal, the works aim to be an expression of a city dweller, and seek to reﬂect on the pace of city living and the fragility of relationships.
column38:
城市快速的轉變和充斥了無限的資訊。

在轉化迅速和不定的環境下，人們不盼望也不容易和周遭的人、事和物建立深厚的關係。

此展覽的作品以白瓷和金屬作為原料,回應以鋼支和水泥䢖成的城市。

長長、易碎、草書似的白瓷支加上軟弱無力的金屬串連…

作者意圖在這系列的作品表達作為城市人的自己,在思考和探索生活步速和各種人和人，人和事，人和物…等等的脆弱關係。

聲音圖書館藝術家駐留計劃
Alessandro Carboni “探索曲線﹣城門河”
column37:
The Library by soundpocket Artist In Residence
Learning Curves/Shing Mun River by Alessandro Carboni

The new stage of Learning Curves takes place in Hong Kong and focuses on the Shing Mun River. The project intends to focus the research on the transformation of the landscape caused by major land reclamation that irrevocably changed the Shatin area.

The dramatic human activity around the Shatin area, which started at the beginning of the 1970s due to land reclamation and extension over the sea, transformed the villages into the biggest residential urban agglomerate in Hong Kong. 

Alessandro Carboni spent two months studying, through an interdisciplinary approach between visual arts, geography and architecture, the Shing Mun River as a place of contact between the two points - the natural landscape and the urban and cultural landscape.

Installation “Sound Topography - diary of body mapping around villages and estates, Shatin”
Date: 5.4.2013 (Fri) | 11am – 7pm／6.4.2013 (Sat) | 10am – 6pm
Venue: Open area near Pai Tau Village, Shatin*Two days only!

Performance “Dialogue on Maps”
Date: 6.4.2013 (Sat) | 10.30am – 12.30pm
Venue: Shatin Rural Committee, 248 Pai Tau Village, Shatin
column38:
聲音圖書館藝術家駐留計劃
Alessandro Carboni “探索曲線﹣城門河”

70年代初，由於填海及海岸擴展，大規模城市化令沙田由鄉村搖身一變而成香港最大的住宅群，而當地人文活動亦因而有著戲劇性的變化。

經過兩個月考察，透過田野錄音及影像搜集、Alessandro以跨界手法包括視覺藝術、地理、建築去審視城門河這個文化及自然環境的交匯點，並研究因填海工程對沙田地域造成的不可逆轉的變遷。

裝置作品：“聲音地誌－身體與沙田屋村及鄉村之對照日記”
4月5日 (星期五) | 11am – 7pm
4月6日 (星期六) | 10am – 6pm
沙田排頭村對外空地(沙田東鐵站B出口)
*只限兩天!

演出：“地圖對談”
日期：4月6日 (星期六) | 10:30am – 12.30pm
地點：沙田排頭村248號沙田鄉事委員會 (沙田東鐵站B出口)

column37: This time, we take you to Ireland, starting from the northern coast and making our way south, discovering the hidden beauty of a country with a tumultuous past. First, we will explore the industrial city of Belfast; then, move to the cultural center of Dublin, and end our journey in the countryside in Cork. We will also bring you to a monumental museum, Titanic Belfast®, which was located in Queen’s Island to commemorate the ill-fated ship, RMS Titanic.

column37: agnès b.’s LIBRAIRIE GALIERIE is pleased to present 「Modern Ghosts3」 exhibition by a Belgian artists collective, Hell’O Monsters. After successfully holding「Modern Ghosts」and 「Modern Ghosts2」exhibitions in France, The collective brings his first-ever show of the same series, 「Modern Ghosts3」, to Asia. Paintings, drawings and installations, including wall drawing will be showcased in agnès b.’s LIBRAIRIE GALERIE, Hong Kong. This time, the gallery will be transformed into a funny, bizarre and mysterious yet poetic imaginary world.

column38: 香港藝術學院賣藝日是學院每年的重點活動之一，一如以往於香港藝術中心舉行，展售多件香港藝術學院學生和校友的藝術作品，讓公眾可藉此難得的機會近距離欣賞藝術，並把藝術品帶回家。在這個學院年度的重點活動，公眾和學生還可互相交流，樂在其中。

column37: Having a conversation with the others is very much like reading a book that records an individual and encompasses their experiences and beliefs. Simply by exchanging dialogues, these stories, experiences and beliefs would quietly seep into each other’s life. In the process of observing their differences and reflecting on their similarities, a unique identity of “Me” is shaped and built. Five students of the Hong Kong Art School’s Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme - each having invited and communicated with a renowned artist - hope to seek inspirations or creative directions with the act of “reflect and refract”.
column38:
與他人傾談交流，就如閱讀著一本有關彼此的書，當中記錄了個人和周遭的故事，也滲透著各自的經驗和信念；傾談過後，這些故事、經驗和信念就悄悄地流進我們彼此的生活，成為彼此生命的一部份。 


這是一個與他者對照的過程，我們從中看見自己與他人的異同，再經交集、磨合、過濾後，慢慢塑造出一個獨一無二的「我」。

為了把這對照的過程帶進創作中，五位香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程的學生，各自邀請了一位自己感興趣的著名藝術家，與他們分別進行交流，希望從「對照」中啟發他們找到屬於自己創作的方向。
